productDescription: - Users appreciate the Wheroamoz Manual Coffee Grinder most for its durability, convenience, handiness and applications during travel and adventure too.
- The ease of use comes next and then comes how sleek and smartly designed it is!
- It is the ultimate value for money, say most users

Our burr grinder breaks coffee down into evenly-sized particles to ensure an even extraction. Its grind function produces consistent results, and It has different of grind settings due to its ceramic grind burr mill - meaning you can grind for every brew method, even Turkish and espresso. Besides this grinder will manually blend your coffee beans without sacrificing the taste.
Whether you’re backpacking, vacationing, or taking a business trip, Wheroamoz hand coffee grinder lets you take your coffee with you wherever you go!

It’s super easy to disassemble and reassemble (with a hopper that can attach to storage containers), It’s as simple as set, load, grind. Throw your beans into the hopper, set your grind setting and turn the handle. Then you can enjoy freshly ground coffee on the road easy. It’s also very easy to clean.
NO REQUIRE ELECTRICITY-For people who like to camp and travel, not needing electricity is a major perk.
Offer this compact and practical manual coffee grinder to all coffee lovers to let them make favorite brewing styles for their own!
When you find yourself in need of your own grinds look no further than Wheroamoz coffee grinder for your everyday coffee needs-It ensures you get your desired coffee experience every time!

it's sturdy, well made and looks cute!
some people complaining about it takes too long to hand grind coffee beans but I like to do it while waiting for the water to heat up and by the time finished grinding enough for one cup of beans :) and it smells so good! and this grinder works really well very finely. Recommend!

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect grinder to go with a press!
reviews.reviewText: The bottom cup for all the grind-coffee holds the perfect amount for a coffee press. I grind till its full using the coarse setting. It took a few tries to get it right, in the end it easily grinds with no effort.

reviews.reviewTitle: Awesome little coffee grinder for travel unless you like packaged Hotel coffee
reviews.reviewText: This is a great little coffee grinder. Stores enough coffee beans to be ground and make 10 cups of coffee. If traveling, bring some coffee filters. Easy to use and clean. Have your cup of freshly ground coffee anywhere you go. Love it!

reviews.reviewTitle: The only downside to my most wonderful gift is the grind time
reviews.reviewText:
I have always used an electic bean grinder. It made quick work of the beans and I was ready to brew very quickly. Unfortunately my grind was inconsistent and consequently my cup of joe was inconsistent.
My wife purchased the manual grinder as a gift for me and I am delighted. It iseasy to store and it even gives me exercise!
This coffee grinder is perfect. Super small and portable and takes up barely any space. Grinds the beans perfectly and makes it so easy to do

reviews.reviewTitle: Just the right volume and grind
reviews.reviewText: Perfect size to grind coffee for my 20oz french press. I wanted something that would make consistent sized grounds and this does it. Only takes a couple of minutes to grind one full measure (i.e. filling the top part with beans). The handle is attached to the spindle so it won't fly off like others can. Using it for my daily brew can't rate it on ease of cleaning as i have not yet cleaned it (and probably wouldn't anyway since it will only be used for coffee). I would by again (but hope I won't need to for a while)

reviews.reviewTitle: 3 settings: Fine, Very fine, and Powder
reviews.reviewText: It grinds coffee beans--true. It is 'adjustable'?--deceptive. Yes, one can 'turn' the dial and 'adjust' the size. But I hope you're only seeking a very similar range of sizes on the fine side. If you want espresso ground coffee, I can't recommend this grinder highly enough. It will powder your coffee very quickly. But if you have a French Press as I do, don't bother. To achieve a grind sufficiently coarse for French Press, one must loosen the grinding mechanism so much that it will, in all probability, fall off. Mine did several times. Now I reduce the grind size and cope with sludge in the bottom of my French Press. As ever, one gets what one pays for.

Awesome grinder perfect for coffee and also for make ground species like whole black pepper,easy for used and cleaning, good quality the stainless steel ,the manual part rotate without any problem dont get the cofee seed stock,the size is perfect for travel.
Love it, can make small amount to fit in my single serve coffee maker. Fresh coffee anytime. Grinds easily and fine for a great cup of coffee. Sturdy, easy to turn, and easy to open top and bottom!

This Was a great coffee grinder. My battery operated one died and I was in need of a new one. I’m glad I went with this one instead of purchasing another battery operated one. This one is easy to clean and grinds my coffee to the perfect texture.
What a great little grinder. Solid built easy to clean holds enough beans for a large pot of coffee or several k cups. The handle folds in for a compact storage.

I was surprise this coffee grinder , today I first try to use , Very easy to use, simple and easy to understand.
And use this coffee grinder, come out coffee powder is very fine.
Now I can drink fresh, ground coffee at any time.

I love expresso, this works out perfect for us . I like how small it is i can store it right next to the press without taking up any space. its also manual so quiet in the morning so my littles one dont wake up. would reccomend

The coffee grinder came already assembled. The instructions and easy to read and understand. It's small in size which makes it very portable. It's about as tall as a 20oz bottle of water. It's also very light weight.
there is no word beside perfect. It would be perfect gift for someone who likes coffee. I bought it for my parents. I guess they will like it as much as I liked.

reviews.reviewTitle: Says Stainless Steel, But What It's Really Plastic
reviews.reviewText: Perhaps I'm naive, but I ordered this grinder because it says it's stainless steel. The truth is-- it is only decorated on the outside with stainless steel. The main body on the inside is made entirely of plastic. The handle and the central shaft are steel and the grinder is ceramic as described, but the metal shaft and ceramic grinder are held in a plastic body. Durability may be a problem over time. Having said that, I am very pleased with the performance and the ease and consistency of the grind. My coffee certainly tastes better in this hand grinder than in my electric burr grinder. So...5 stars for performance, but 3 stars for construction -- therefore 4 stars total.

No uniform grind whatsoever. No matter how much the adjustment is tightened or loosened it never performs like they said it would. Company messaged me right after delivery saying they would give me another on for a 5 star review. No this is junk and poorly made to boot.

reviews.reviewTitle: Stucked when ground whole coffee bean
reviews.reviewText: I bought the item because its good looking design and help my in my kitchen work. But the grinder is stuck at the first time i uesd, cannot grind whole coffee . I have to return it.

Awesome Coffee grinder. My favorite thing is the size and how easy it is to clean. I have a keurig at the office and I can grind the beans at home and easily bring them with me to use in my refillable Kcup.

This item is well built but only grinds up to 2 tablespoons of coffee. The top chamber is so small that coffee beans fall everywhere even if you are very careful. The grinding takes quite a bit of effort and time for so little result. You also cannot control the grind of the bean.

I was very disappointed and this was a waste of money for me. Some things are good in the traditional form. This is not one of them. Just get an electric burr grinder for $30-35, and save yourself some aggravation and wasted time and money.

The seller was fantastic though. The item arrived quickly and in perfect condition.

reviews.reviewTitle: Difficult to clean, does not disassemble
reviews.reviewText:
Does not disassemble completely without a screwdriver, and the screws are already stripped fresh from the factory, so I did not attempt to remove them, or I wouldn't have been able to reassemble. Resultantly, it is quite difficult to clean the grinders, as they cannot be removed from the housing.

It's effective for now, but cannot be easily cleaned, and the construction is cheap, disposable grade. A well-built product would make it easy to disassemble and remove the grinders for easy cleaning and replacement, with a durable construction that supports frequent disassembly and reassembly.

I was really excited to get this today and try it out for the first time. Was pretty disappointed that it took me 30 minutes to grind my first batch of grinds. The base actually carries a small amount of grinds for my need so takes two rounds. Returning this product. Don't want another free one if I leave a 5 star review if I don't even like the one that I actually paid for. For 6 dollars more you can get a much better quality grinder you wont have to waste your time returning.

reviews.reviewTitle: Coffee where you don’t have electricity
reviews.reviewText: Too much of a pain to take my grinder on vacation but this will fit in my suitcase and I can have really good coffee
We used this one time and the bolt on top wouldn't stay screwed on making it impossible to grind the beans. We had to send it back.

the product overall is great! easy to use, sleek and perfect grind every time. I just wished the small booklet offered a bit more detail around grind settings. it does not. you basically have to figure out the size of each grind through trial and error.
A sturdy and stylish grinder for $25? Yes! The value of the item is emboldened by a life-time warranty. It is small, yet has chambers to grind plenty of coffee. I recommend this grinder for purchase.

reviews.reviewTitle: Decent grinder but they buy 5 star reviews
reviews.reviewText:
I bought this to be an grinder for a french press. I subtracted a star because the grinding gear is oval shaped instead of round which would be a problem if I needed a fine ground. It is not worth the hassle to return for a replacement. The cleaning process is not documented and very few parts can be removed for cleaning.

I took the second star off because they tried to bribe me with a free grinder if I gave them a five star review.

This is a very simple device, easy to use and clean, grinds perfectly, and looks good on the kitchen counter. The adjustment for fine vs. coarse is a little difficult to figure out since it has no calibration, so it's hard to tell what setting it's on. Having said that, whatever setting I have it on, it works perfectly. It does require a firm grip on the cylinder, but the grinding handle is smooth and easy to rotate. Couldn't be more delighted.
We travel often and this has been the perfect fit for our family! I love making our coffee with freshly ground coffee beans and my boys love to help with the grinding.
I personally like this manual coffee grinder kind of small and easy to carry for travel no hassel for cleaning

Zero consistency at various grind level setups. This is not good as I only prepare using pour over and the micro grinds go straight to the bottom of my filter and block the liquid from escaping in a timely manner. This has ruined several pours of my limited edition geisha coffee in the last few days.

reviews.reviewTitle: I recommend this to everyone who drinks coffee
reviews.reviewText: I really like this.. it's small and compact so you can have a fresh cup off coffee anywhere... it's easy to keep clean and that's my fav. part is the easy clean up..
I love fresh coffee and this product has allowed me to make the perfect portions write it hassle.

HUGE coffee drinker! i love this it is easy to set up and easy to use! i didnt need instructions as much. you can grinf your own coffee and however much you want. it can be convient for someone who doesnt have a bunch of kids but i would reccomend your coffee will taste better if you use this tool. Best coffee because of this1!

Bought this for our RV where I prefer more compact items... it is easy to use and grinds perfectly for my little drip coffee maker. There was paperwork with the grinder that implied that the company would send a second item (free?) and wanted you to sign up for email etc. I'm all for having a second one and all but the paperwork, the way it was done, said if I gave my email I'd spend the rest of my life being spammed. It was odd, poor marketing material because it definitely came off on the spammy side. Maybe whoever did it was just trying to be overly happy but it sure drove me away. If it was just overly happy, I still would suggest to the company that they redo it more professionally and make it clear where the company is, that they have privacy rules and what those are and that they aren't going to spam you.
it grinds coffee, would bed great for travel or camping, the setting feature is also pretty cool.

First impression out of the box: Parts fit well and ergonomics are excellent. Information card is surprisingly clear and concise. It is difficult to actually determine the course to fine settings, but with a little trial and error there is a small difference in the grind. Given 3 or 4 settings it is not that noticeable. Low 'gear ratio' requires many turns to grind 20g of beans and some time and patience is required. The result is consistent and yields a surprising good grind for espresso. Small, compact and lightweight is particularly suited to traveling, camping or at home during a power outage or daily single serving brews. Only time will tell if the plastic internal parts can withstand daily use, but its not a huge concern since it is covered by a lifetime warranty.. Overall, a well designed handy grinder that adequately fills the need if or when you have one.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for grinding on the go!
reviews.reviewText: Easy to use grinder great for camping or on the go. I use it in the field when I want to be the fancy soldier.

This is my first burr grinder, so I don’t have anything to compare it to. It seems to work quite well and is nicely made. I tried it out this morning with my French press and the coffee tasted great! I ground a second batch to make cold brew. Looking forward to that.
I noticed pictures of people using battery powered drills on the small grinders and I understand why. It takes a LOT of cranking to get the coffee ground, so I tried using a drill. MUCH FASTER. I ran my drill at a very low speed because I didn’t want to damage the grinder and it worked perfectly. I removed the handle and put the retaining nut back on so I didn’t damage the threads. Worked like a champ!
Will post an update if things change, but so far, very impressed!

I bought this grinder yesterday and I found it very easy to use. There are 3 parts and you can grind fine or coarse beans, by turning the crane left or right. I like using it for espresso beans for my Bialetti and the flavor is amazing! Only tip for buyers is I find you don't have to wash it often as it seems that would not be good for the grinding mechanism.

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect if you have one preferred brew method, otherwise look elsewhere
reviews.reviewText:
Overall this grinder is excellent for the price, and will save you $70 on a decent burr grinder (do not buy a cheap electrical burr, trust me). That being said, it is not a good product for me.

A bit of context, if you know how burr grinders work and why coffee snobs like me prefer them, skip this bit: the whole point of a burr grinder is to be able to create grounds of adjustable sizes ranging from coarse (big chunks) to fine (tiny chunks). The reason for this is that different coffee brew methods require different grind sizes. Every burr grinder is different, and it takes a bit of experimentation to get the grind size just right for a given brew method.

The problem with this grinder is that, once I've found the perfect spot on the dial for my espresso I have no way to mark that and remember it. This sucks because I often switch brew methods, from drip to pour over to french press etc, so every time I switch brew methods I need to experiment again to find that perfect setting.

Otherwise this grinder is excellent for the price. The grind is nice and even, it's easy to operate (not too tiring, doesn't take long), and easy to disassemble and clean. If you need a cheap burr to bring your espresso to the next level then look no further. If you need a burr to satisfy all your brewing needs, be it pour over or french press, then you should probably keep looking.
I gave the grinder as a gift. They loved the grinder. Very nice product. This item was suppose to be free after my 5 start review. I'm waiting on my refund.

reviews.reviewTitle: A grinder that works well in a small package
reviews.reviewText: I'm new to coffee (big time tea drinker and still am) so like my tea I wanted the best quality drink. That means starting with roasted beans and needing a grinder. I'm not ready to go for an electric so looked for a reliable solid manual that wasn't too big to clutter the storage space but large enough to grind for 1-2 shots. This one fits the requirements perfectly! It is as compact as you will likely find and yet it has a millstone approach to the grinding (no blade cutting). Crank handle folds in, the unit comes apart easily with a simple twist in 2 places. Grind coarseness is adjustable by turning a wing-nut tighter or looser. Hopper holds about 22 gm of beans, the lower compartment catches the grounds nicely and a twist of the base and it is removed to allow pouring into whatever you plan to steep the coffee with. Note that while you do have to turn the crank a while to get a scoop of beans ground up, it's much quieter than an electric units i've heard before. It takes less than a couple minutes to grind up a scoop (17 gm) of beans. Cleanup is easy, as the parts come apart easily.

I wanted to get back to my roots not buying pre-ground coffee a lot of people have said that buying the beans and grinding them yourselves and using a French press makes super coffee so I said what the hay I might as well try this after I received it I went to my local grocery store and picked up some fresh beans after I put them in I ground them and I found out it's very easy to use it's small compact and if you wanted to you could take it traveling with you and also it comes apart very easily to clean if you feel that you need to I don't think so because it's just coffee grounds it's not like it's going to rain
Nice travel coffee grinder.. now I can have a fresh ground coffee when I travel.. this is very durable and super easy to ground coffee with
I love how well made this grinder is!!! It is perfect for on the go, or even just saving on the electricity bill! Love it.
Not easy to grind beans....you definitely get a workout. Broke after two weeks of use. Would not recommend.

I am in love with this simple to use coffee grinder. It cannot get any fresher than this for brewing my freshly grounded coffee bean for my morning cup of joe. I’m pleased with my purchase and truly enjoy the portability of this cute device
I used it and it is easy use .You can grind the coffer easily and it is smooth and cleans without effort
It was a must to try as soon as I got it. It is so easy to use, and grinds perfectly! Very pleased with the product! Would highly recommend!

reviews.reviewTitle: A better way to get fresh ground coffee!
reviews.reviewText: I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of this coffee grinder. I’ve wanted to experiment with fresh ground coffee for use with my press. I tried an electric grinder but I’d end up with a mix of powder and chunks. I have heard that hand grinders give a more consistent grind. So on to this grinder... First l really like the size and shape of this grinder. It’s triangular and easy to hold. It has a solid feel to it. The size makes it easy to pack with my AeroPress. The grind size is easily adjustable and consistent. I really appreciate the handle folding design which offers better leverage while closing up to save space (plus it stops you from turning the grinder counter-clockwise which would damage it). The cost is very reasonable so the price point for the quality. As for cleaning I’ll tell you that this design is so easy and no mess. With the electric grinder I’d have coffee grounds (and powder) all over the place by the time I was done.

The grinder is a great product. Be sure to read the manual before you start grinding away like I did. I was frustrated that the grinder “wasn’t working” but the setting to grind was set too tight on delivery. Once I figured that out, I was grinding coffee like no one’s business. I even kept increasing the grind size and it showed progressively. It’s pretty awesome. I was surprised that the grinder is so small and the hopper only takes about a handful of beans at a time. Then again, it’s perfect for espresso.
Very satisfied.

I really like this coffee grinder. I have recently started to use a Keurig coffee maker and refuse to buy the high priced pods. I can’t be bothered with the fuss of an electric bean grinder for just one person, so, based on reviews, I purchased this. It took awhile experimenting to get the grind right so I practiced using some very old Starbucks Italian roast beans that had been opened and stored in cupboard a long time! Once I got the grind right, the coffee came out amazing! I like my coffee dark and rich and it did not disappoint! I had my daughter, former Starbucks barista, taste it and she too thought it was very good. The shape of the grinder and size work well with my arthritic thumbs. I’m very pleased with the product!

reviews.reviewTitle: Your go-to help for a quick coffee
reviews.reviewText: This is one such grinder that is easy to clean, grinds appropriately but when it comes to ease of use, I think it should have some suction small cups at the bottom that could fix its position while someone is grinding the beans. One may start feeling a bit of pain in the hands after grinding for long. Apart from that the ground coffee came out just fine and also tasted good. Love it especially during the travel. It is great for grinding some Indian spices as well.

I got this because my electric blade coffee grinder is inconsistent (or maybe it's me). I wanted a consistent grind for my French press and this delivered. If it breaks I'll change my review, but for now I am a happy camper.

Great product ! Easy to use
Its good to bring it on the trip too
I didn't even get a chance to try this grinder. It arrived with the threaded rod snapped off where you would attach the handle. The rod was broken off inside the nut.
I bought this for spices and it works well for that. I like the sleek stainless steel design. I grind my spices in small batches when I need them so a manual grinder is needed.
Nice product and works as advertised. Grinding compartment holds enough to do a pot of french press..
Easy to use worked great for my French press

reviews.reviewTitle: Exactly what I was looking for
reviews.reviewText: It's a great product, especially at the price. It's very easy to use, clean and store. The adjuster is a little hard to find and takes some practice to figure out what the settings actually produce.
Great for travel and easy to clean.
Use to grind coffee. Does a constant grind. Built very solid.

Works like a charm! I actually use mine for grinding fish pellets to make dough bait for method baits. The fish pellets are about as tough as a coffee bean so this product had no problem grinding them right up.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works as intended but hard to clean thoroughly and gives you an arm workout
reviews.reviewText: It's pretty easy to use. You unscrew the top part with the crank and put the coffee in there. Then keep cranking it and the ground beans will come out into the plastic part. Make sure you only turn the crank clockwise. Turning it counterclockwise might cause damage. The actual grinder part where you put the whole beans is a bit hard to clean. I used a small brush but it doesn't reach the crevices very well and the part beneath the blades still has coffee stains on it. It does work as intended but you also get an arm workout from using it. I take that as a good thing, because it feels like I'm getting in some of my daily work out haha.

reviews.reviewTitle: Buy a larger grinder for home usage, takes a long time to make even one cup.
reviews.reviewText:
Sturdy product, but it requires an unusually large amount of time in order to grind enough coffee for a single cup. I’ll use typically 30g of coffee for a large cup, that requires loading it and emptying it twice... for that single cup of coffee.

I would say for those who want something to use at home: buy a larger grinder because this thing doesn’t cut it.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is an awesome little travel grinder!
reviews.reviewText:
Yesterday evening I received my package. I was excited, but it was too late for coffee. So I took the grinder out of the box, and it was modestly wrapped. The instruction manual is straightforward and straight forward, showing the features of this little grinder.

Taking it out and inspecting the grinder, the first thing I notice is that it fits neatly in the palm of my hand and is very comfortable to hold. The handle that will operate the grinder itself is set at a reasonable distance so that I don't wrack my knuckles by hitting the grinder itself and the rotating action is smooth and easy.

Taking the grinder apart is a snap. Just rotate around 15 degrees, and the reservoir comes apart from the bottom, and the top comes away just as easy. On the bottom of the grinder, you can open the gap to set the type of grind, fine to coarse.

The next morning is coffee time :) and using this grinder is a snap. I agree with others that it takes a while to use, but it is manual. If one is used to an electric grinder, this is slower, but it is not slow. This grinder works well and produces a great grind. The coffee is ground the way I'd expect, and I can see using this no my business travel, camping, or when I don't want to plug in my electric grinder. I use my Keurig with a solo fill, and this grinder works perfectly for that amount of coffee.

Get this grinder for yourself. It is worth every penny.
It’s very compact.Great for camping trips .Dose a great job

reviews.reviewTitle: A must have in your kitchen
reviews.reviewText: This can grind anything. I am not sure about this type of coffee grinders but when I ordered it, I didn't know how it works. I just wanted t have something that can grind coffee for one cup so that I can have fresh grounded coffee every time I need a coffee. Just put the beans, grind it and you are done. It also stores the grounded powder. You can choose the coarse or grinding. Can be used with black pepper too for fresh grounded black pepper :)

I've been using this grinder for about a week now. Keep finding that I want to use it more and more. The best feature of this grinder, IMO, is that the shape is triangular and not round - it does not slip in your hand. It seems durable enough so far. Consistency of grounds is good but I improve it by running the first batch through grinder again - it makes the ground perfect.
Good quality, consistent grind.

I got this grinder because I wanted to grind different things for homemade beauty products. My first item was grinding eggshells for a powder toothpaste. It did an excellent job. I passed once on course and a second time on fine. Much easier that the mortar and pestle I used last time. Easy to clean! Look forward to using it on many different projects!
Compact and easy to pack/use

Very impressed and happy. The product literally gives me a better tasting cup of coffee! I previously had a Bialetti, but it was plastic and it broke. With the construction of this one, there is more support to prevent a twisting force from breaking the snaps that hold the mechanism closed. The Bialetti was purely plastic with no additional support on the outside. This product is surrounded and supported by steel. I don’t anticipate this product from breaking! Additionally it is much more smooth as well and requires less force to grind. I enjoy very fine ground coffee for pour overs, and this product gives a better tasting cup of coffee. I attribute this to the very fine and uniform grounds. It took longer to grind the coffee, which I initially thought was a negative, however after using it several times I’ve learned it is because of the fine grounds I’m using and it’s uniformity.
Very well made and easy to use. My husband is taking it camping and loves fresh ground coffee.

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect size and easy to clean
reviews.reviewText:
I got this mostly to use for coffee at home and traveling. Echoing all the other reviews, it's the perfect size for this, the handle folds up and it packs easily, and I've only made one cup so far to test it out but based on that it seems to hold about 8-10 cups worth of beans, depending how strong you brew. More than enough for most of the traveling I do.

I'm also going to use it sometimes as a spice grinder so it was important to me that it be easy to clean and not hang onto smells (too badly, I understand it's eventually going to smell like coffee no matter what). So far it's perfect. Again, just a test, I made one cup of coffee yesterday, then cleaned and dried it overnight and ground some whole allspice this morning. After it was done drying I tapped it on the counter to shake out lingering coffee grounds. The allspice came out with no coffee smell or taste, and I washed the grinder again right away and it doesn't smell like allspice now as it's drying. It also handled the allspice, which is harder than coffee beans, with very little protest.

I see getting 2-3 years of frequent use out of it. Great for the price and will keep one more electric device out of my kitchen for at least that much longer.

If it continues working this well and seems sturdy I will probably get another just for spices.

reviews.reviewTitle: It broke within a month and a half.
reviews.reviewText: The plastic grove in the crank wore away within a month and a half and does not fit into the metal shaft. Must be very cheaply made. Better to buy one that lasts longer than getting a replacement every time it breaks.

reviews.reviewTitle: Well designed ceramic coffee grinder that's affordable
reviews.reviewText:
Pleased with this purchase for making coarse ground coffee in Aeropress, so electric blade grinder not suited. The key to using this is adjusting the grind size by turning the circular grind head inside the grinder. To calibrate, I turned it all the way clockwise to tighten until it stopped, then turned 10 clicks counterclockwise. Adjust from there.

Because you will be turning the crank a lot (!0 I particularly like the rounded triangular shape of the grinder because of how well if fits in your hand while grinding. While the grinding handle is a bit awkwardly designed because of the "fold" I appreciate how the additional length reduces the effort required to make a circuit.

I really excellent acquisition that could also be useful for traveling because of the compact size. Recommended!

This thing is a HAND grinder, it requires you to twist the crank. Easy to adjust the grind setting, I make espresso, so I can’t speak to the bigger grind requirements. Ergonomically designed, easy to hold. I make coffee for two in the morning, so I need a fair amount for that. I was making it all in the morning, and with this grinder, it was a little tedious, so I now grind enough for the morning, the night before, I know a true snob would never do this. but I find the compromise just fine. I can make two cups, and be back in bed before I’m too cold. I would sure buy another one. I would probably not buy this if I was making coffee for a crew, and needed volume, but for two it works fine.

Bought this to replace an electric blade grinder to grind beans for cold brew. Yes, it does take longer than an electric grinder but the grinds are of a consistent coarseness which is essential for cold brew. I found it easy to adjust the coarseness by turning the black part counterclockwise. I held the rotating handle in place while adjust the piece counterclockwise. The manual doesn’t tell you to do this but I found it made adjusting easier. Grinder is nice and quiet too in case you are up late getting your cold brew going or up early while others are sleeping.
The grinder is easy to use, easy to clean, and makes grinding more fun!
Inconsistent grind this co offers free merch to leave a 5 star review
easy to use. great!

Was looking at a larger electric grinder but the reviews were all: it's too loud, it stopped working after a while of using it, the grind was inconsistent....so I decided to go for the manual grinder and I'm glad I did, it's perfect for single cup use, not loud at all, easy to clean and compact. Easy to test the grind for correct coarseness.

Update: this grinder only worked for 2 weeks and now does not give a consistent grind no matter the setting.

reviews.reviewTitle: Handle broke immediately! Was never able to use it.
reviews.reviewText: The handle broke immediately, on the very first test grind with a tiny amount of coffee beans. Absolute garbage product in terms of quality control. Don't waste your time or money on this.

reviews.reviewTitle: Spend a few bucks more for a steardy product w/ a lifetime warrenty
reviews.reviewText: I had a grinder like this before and after less than two years it broke. (It actually broke a lot sooner than that, but I was still able to use it). I am usually the type of buyer who will find a cheaper product if it has a good amount of good reviews, but with a lifetime warrenty on this one, it's a no brainer. I love the design. The handle folds in so it's good for traveling. It's steardy as all get out. Because of the size, which does make it easier for traveling, I have to fill it up twice for my daily coffee, but that's an extra 10 seconds, so who cares. Do yourself a favor and just get this one.

This is beautiful and works great. Very easy to use. Grinder mechanism seems strong. Able to grind fine and coarse. Comes apart for easy cleaning. Looks great displayed next to coffee maker. Would make a great gift with coffee beans since fresh ground coffee tastes the best!

reviews.reviewTitle: Good for small French press, not for cold brew
reviews.reviewText: Had to return because the amount of beans you can put in there is SO SMALL. Bought this for my cold brew maker (needs 2 cups coarse grounds) but is going to take an entirety to fill... looks nice though!

This is a very cute stylish grinder with a lifetime warranty. It works great, similar to the pepper grinders we all see. I plan on taking on my next hotel vacation since hotel brand coffee isn't that great. The grinder's size is nice, since its small and you will probably only fit 1 filter after about 3 re-fills/grinds.

I haven’t had this long at all, but I am quite liking it. It is very tiny, which is fine for me but be warned if you want to grind coffee for more than one person. I can grind while I’m waiting for the water to boil, and while my French press is steeping, I grind the next cup. Also, because of the size it’s easy to hold in one hand while I turn the grinder with the other. And because it’s small it’s not noisy, so it won’t disturb others.

Cons: because it is tiny it can be difficult to put beans in the grinding space without spilling them. Or maybe I’m just clumsy LOL. The size also makes cleaning a little awkward.

This is a nice small grinder. I’ve only just received it but was playing with it to check on how well it ground up the coffee beans. I had some nice fine grounds and dialed it up to courser grounds for my French Oress. If there was one thing to change would be numbers settings for grind size so if it gets changed from the settings I could reset it easily. The grinder itself is very easy to use and I can see it being used often so I can have freshly ground beans to make my coffee.

reviews.reviewTitle: One Of My Best Purchases . . . Ever
reviews.reviewText: This is my first manual grinder, and I love it because it eliminates all the shortcomings of electric grinders. Unlike electric grinders: (1) the grounds are uniform, (2) fine grounds do not get caked on to the receptacle, (3) pouring the grounds into the coffee maker, whatever size or configuration, is easy and not a messy proposition, and (4) although not silent, the grinding is not the loud, obnoxious sound of most electric grinders. Everything is clean and simple. The grinder is perfect for me because I make a single cup with my Delter or Aero-Press. I would probably resort to an electric grinder if I had to make a pot of coffee for others.

reviews.reviewTitle: You are getting a great value with this product
reviews.reviewText: I have only used this product once so far, but I am really happy with my purchase. I was looking for an inexpensive grinder as I had bought some whole bean coffee, but also wanted one that did not take up much space. So far, this checks all my requirements; It is easy to change the coarse/fine dial, easy to add in my coffee, and easy to lock and unlock the holder for the grounds. The turning handle to operate it wound smoothly and you can even loosen the lnob on top to fold it in if you need to store it in a smaller space. This is a wonderful product!

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect if you enjoy making a good coffee
reviews.reviewText: The handle and body are made of stainless steel, the grinding mechanism is ceramic, and the grinded coffee goes into a transparent plastic base. This grinder is the way to go if you want a a coarse grind for your french press and do not want to spend a small fortune on an electric ceramic burr grinder. It takes a few minutes to grind enough beans for your cup, but if you enjoy taking your time to make a good cup of coffee, then you will like this.

I live in a tiny trailer with no room for a big coffee pot or grinder. This little handheld grinder is PERFECT for my pour over system. Easy to load, grind, and properly measure exactly how much I need. The size also makes it easy to tuck into a drawer to store if need be. I'm happy I no longer have to get preground coffee that goes stale WAY quicker than whole bean.

I had my husband test this coffee grinder for me since he's a truck driver and if you know truck drivers, they love their coffee! He used it for 2 weeks before I asked him how he liked it. He absolutely loved it! Several places he went had coffee beans you had to grind yourself but you had to stand in line to use the grinder, he said it was easy to use, convenient, and easy to clean up afterwards and being the size it was, it was easy to store out of the way.

I bought this because I am trying to get away from electric appliances that are costly to fix/replace and take up tons of landfill space. So, for that reason, I kept it. But, for a medium grind coffee, the grind is inconsistent. Sometimes the coffee gets stuck and I have to shake it to get it to fall down into the grinding area. It makes just enough for two cups in a French press. When this one breaks I will look for something else.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easily transportable great gift for your coffee lover.
reviews.reviewText: Super easy to use and transportable. My kids had fun grinding up my coffee beans this morning. This manual grinder makes it fun to prepare your coffee in the morning. Ideally used for traveling instead of an electric grinder. This is a nice gift for your friends that love coffee and have everything they need.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works well, single-cup capacity, takes time and effort
reviews.reviewText: The grinder works as advertised. You can create a variety of grinds. I thought I'd move from powered to manual grinding for a meditative practice before brewing a pot. To make a pot for two, however, takes two fills of beans - which is enough to fill the bottom part with a sufficient quantity of ground coffee. The challenge is that it takes quite a while to grind the coffee. It's more workout that meditation ;-) I will be acquiring an electric grinder for daily use. I do like the quality of the burr ground coffee.

reviews.reviewTitle: What's better than fresh ground coffee?
reviews.reviewText:
The grinder is well constructed and very portable for what it is. I don't know if I'd take it backpack camping, but car camping sure. The fact that it is a manual unit, and its size makes it a great portable companion to a French press or Gialetti espresso pot for the outdoors, and small tidy unit for home.

Grind beans well, adjustment knob is a bit hard to get to and capacity is a but small, but both are not ideal breakers or something that would prevent me from buying another. Enjoy your brew with this great little grinder.

We have an aeropress, and it requires the beans to be finely ground.
This grinder provides a fine and even grind. My cup of coffee tastes great! It’s always nicer to have a cup of freshly ground beans.
I washed it with water and soap, but the ceramic still has the coffee “stain” which is fine. You can remove the adjuster and clean it well. I guess I won’t be rinsing it any time soon.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice little grinder, better than the electric.
reviews.reviewText:
The grinder worked as expected and was able to taste the coffee better than my electrical grinder! a big plus! The handle bar seemed a bit rough/sharp to touch but did its work. I can taste the Philz "New Manhattan" as it should be :)

Update: Fri Oct 25 15:53:58 PDT 2019
Interestingly after product registration the site eluded to a second free grinder which I learned is on the condition of a 5-star rating!!!. I declined, which also drove me to try the JavaPresse. Which I find it better for holding the handle while grinding. Also JavaPresse has helpful guidance on adjusting the grind for the kind of coarseness, which i found to be very helpful. JavaPresse hopper seems to hold bit more beans than the Wheroamoz, helpful for my drip/cone.

Except for the above I still like Wheroamoz, but their unethical practice is bothersome to Amazon reviews. Changing to 4-stars.

reviews.reviewTitle: Do not buy this piece of crap.
reviews.reviewText: This grinder is complete garbage. It looks good, feels sturdy. It feels like it should work, but it is just god awful for grinding. Expect to hand grind for 20-30 min. Other hand grinders are expected to take 5-7 min. Please do yourself a favor and spend more than $50 for a good hand grinder.

I'm just now trying to get into being a coffee freak, and bought this so I can ground my own coffee each day for a French press. So far I love it! It's easy to use, I just rinse it out after each use. It is a bit small, I can only grind one coffee cups worth of coffee at a time. But fortunately I'm the only one in my household who uses it so no worries there. If you make several cups at a time, I would buy a much bigger one!
I also like how easy it is to adjust the grinder for which grind/courseness of coffee you'd like.
Make no mistake, shop no further get this one. It is just what you need. Love it, so will you.But the offers for free gift cards and free grinders do not appear legitimate.
Ground coffee as fine as I needed it

I had never used a manual coffee grinder before, but going to the BWCAW I wanted to be able to still have fresh ground coffee. I purchased because of the advertised compact design. It is very compact and durably built. Easy to adjust the course of grounds. The best part is the lifetime warranty. Very few companies still stand behind their products to this extent. Took several minutes to register the product. Response time from customer service was superb.
Got this for my mother. She loves it. Shes a coffee nut. This is great for some1 who likes to be involved in this coffee making process.

reviews.reviewTitle: Poor Product. Performance not as claimed. Dont waste your money
reviews.reviewText:
I bought on the basis of the large number of buyers and the high ratings but it was terribly disappointing.

It could not grind the green coffee. Unfortunately , I don"t live in the USA and cannot entertain a refund

Go for something solid and electrical. This is a waste of time and money

reviews.reviewTitle: Solid Product, Great Quality and EASY to use!
reviews.reviewText:
Really nicely put together (not cheap at all). Two clicks is all you need to get a GREAT CUP of coffee (don't forget to add the beans)! This manual coffee grinder is easy to assemble and use, and you're grinding away perfect grounds for that PERFECT cup of coffee.
Able to easily adjust the setting for the type of brew we drink (Espresso Press). This size is best to make your individual cup (not ideal for a 12-cup portion of beans), and it provides a perfect measure for a cup.
Makes for a perfect travel/camping item to take your beans with you. PLUS, you're only burning calories to use the grinder! If you can't figure out how to use this, you probably shouldn't be working around hot liquids or be in charge of making anything (let alone a cup of coffee).

reviews.reviewTitle: IF YOU WANT TO SPEND ALL DAY
reviews.reviewText: It literally took 30 min to manually grind enough coffee for 1 cup of espresso and there is no actual espresso setting. Instructions are very limited was hard to open AND THEN you get to grind forever to try to get enough for one cup in the espresso maker. Should have at least read reviews before I ordered. For functionality and every other way I can think of not worth any price, let alone the price I paid.
This grinder is way more superior to my mr coffee grinder. It makes a huge difference with how my espresso comes out, a lot more crema!
Best grinder I ever had and it east too clean

I just received my new Wheroamoz manual coffee grinder, and I'm in my happy place. One thing I do to somewhat save the ceramic implement is first I grind on coarse, then regrind it again on fine. I know it takes time. But it's worth it because I get a
finer grind than the electric grinder I currently own. Oh, and by the way, the coffee tastes so much better because you grind just enough for a cup or
two. I will never go back to store bought ground coffee.

This is the fourth manual burr grinder I have bought online. My others (from a different brand) each broke. They cost around $10, but lasted for less than a year. This time I decided to spend more money for a higher quality product. The Wheroamoz grinder looks and feels more solid, and the extending grinder arm decreases the effort needed to grind. The reason I am giving this only 3 stars is because the capacity is much less than that of the cheaper grinders. I estimate that I can grind about 25% less beans than before. Not a big deal, but the need to refill the grinder was unexpected. Also, the capacity of the grinder is not advertised as it should be, given that the prevalent manual grinders on the market have a significantly larger capacity. I know this because I have bought multiple other brands of manual ceramic burr grinders and they were all nearly identical and appeared to come from the same manufacturer and all had a higher capacity than this Wheroamoz model.

I’ve been looking for a coffee grinder after my electric one rusted (my fault). This is good looking and easy to use. It doesn’t affect the quality of the coffee but it’s nice to have an option for it to grind. Additionally, I use it to grind while spices, such as pepper.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use, compact manual coffee grinder
reviews.reviewText: This is a great little grinder. It's easy to use and does an excellent job producing a fine grind. Remember that it's manual, so it will take many turns of the crank to completely grind the full hopper and produce enough for two cups of coffee, but it's compact and the handle folds for easy storage and packing for outdoor activities. The ground coffee stays in the see-through compartment until you are ready to use it, and clean up is easy.

I had stopped making latte at home because electric grinders were too inconsistent or too coarse. Found this and decided to try it out and am loving it. It lets you set the grind manually, from very fine to very coarse. Espresso ends up with an awesome crema.
It is REALLY easy to open the top of the grinder to add beans and the bottom to get grounds. It pours nicely out of the bottom as well!

reviews.reviewTitle: Small for a single person but easily transportable.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this after trying freshly grounded coffee at my office. The taste is unbelievable when you ground coffee compared to packed grounded coffee. This grinder is small in size so it is ideal for 1 to 2 people the most. it grinds coffee without any issues and also has a collections jar to collect all the grounded coffee. I am loving this and i use it everyday to fresh just the right amount of coffee for myself.

This is a handy lil grinder , it works perfect ! It’s easy to use , grinds well without much effort, it’s easy to clean and takes up very little space , making it great for traveling, camping etc..
This would also make a nice practical gift as well .

Ordered it and got it in a day and a half which I love. The design is amazing!! Stainless steel, easy clean up. I love the size of it. Easy to travel with . And best thing of all it grinds great!! I even was able to grind up tea Leaves and other ingredients to make a soothing tea. You gotta purchase this coffee grinder . It's a great value and an even better product.

I know this is for grinding coffee but I bought it for grinding flax seeds based on the answer to a question above. It is not effective for flax - either the seeds fall through whole or 5 turns gives a drop of dust. Saving someone from purchasing it for flax grinding. Seems to be good quality for coffee.

It’s absolutely exhausting trying to grind my beans in this thing! Too small and handle too short. It doesn’t grind finely enough. My coffee ends up waterier than the usual (with my electric grinder).

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use and works well
reviews.reviewText:
If you're like me and spent a good 2 weeks trying to pick between the hundreds of coffee grinders available on Amazon. I kept jumping back and forth between this one and a $10 one that looked pretty much the same. I'll just say, I have no regrets getting this one. I've been burned many times getting something that was super cheap and then it turning out to be a cheaply made product as well (no surprise...) Then again, I've only use the product twice so far so we shall see!

Updated to 4 stars: it still works fine but after using it for a while, I realized I never get a consistent grind size. The grinds always have a range of courseness and I think it's because the conical bur is not centered properly. Coffee tastes okay still, but I would prefer and even grind size.

I recently had my manual hand grinder break on me after three years. It served me well in that time. Was looking to get something similar and came across this product. After just one use, I could tell this thing was made well and worked quite well. I usually do a pour-over or french press and this provided a very consistent grind size for each. I'm sure it works just as well for the others grind settings. It has an easy to turn knob to your preferred grind setting and a clear base to see how the coffee is being ground. I'd definitely recommend this product!

Pretty easy and self explanatory on how to use and adjust, if you could afford an automatic burr mill which is pretty up there in cost to just grind coffee.....then go for it. For me I like making just a 12 oz in the morning, the settings takes just a little try to get the preferred grind right and after that you can just grind away with consistency. I notice that this can take on 3 scoops of coffee beans, which is enough for 3 cups of coffee (granted that each cup is 4-6oz) just the right amount I need to fill the jar attachment at the other end. Also I love that fresh smell of hand grounded coffee!!!! ugh!!! no complaint about the product here =] ! Nice that its portable too.

reviews.reviewTitle: A coffee connoisseur must have one or a great gift for one
reviews.reviewText: If you're a coffee snob on a budget like me, this grinder is perfect.. I've gone through a few manual ones that I've paid more for & they were more work to use and clean. This comes fully assembled & the only thing you have to do is adjust how coarse you want your beans ground. The other thing I love is that it has a clear container attached to the bottom so there's no mess while you can see how much your grinding. Whatever your method of brewing, this grinder is perfect!

The Whereamoz coffee grinder is exactly what it’s advertised as. The upper outer layer is made of stainless steel, making it quite durable and aesthetically pleasing. It is also very easy to clean as it can be readily dismantled.

Full disclosure: I feel obligated to mention that the company offers you a free coffee grinder if you give them a 5-star review. This, of course, makes my review biased in favor of Whereamoz. I do, however, genuinely believe that the grinder is deserving of a 5-star review.

reviews.reviewTitle: It does Job #1 and it does it well
reviews.reviewText: Wasn't sure what to expect, but I needed a new bean grinder. This seemed to fit the bill. Metal blades and a visible reservoir of grounds made this seem a good risk. I've now been using it for about two months and it has done perfectly. I like how the handle folds away to keep it compact. I'm picking up another to put in my camping gear.

Got this so i could use a coarse grind for a french press. It does a great job. The grind is easily adjustable and very consistent. It's light and doesn't take up much space so will be good for travel or camping. It isn't very big so if you want to grind a lot it'll take a while but for me it's perfect. The only issue is that you have to be careful pouring in the beans because the opening is a bit small. but overall I love it and would gladly recommend it. In fact I'm planning on giving a couple as presents.

I got this grinder for small batches and traveling. It is very well built. The locking catch cup and top is great! You know for sure that the cup and top is attached and won’t come off mid grind. Clean up is easy. It takes little effort to grind your coffee. It takes longer than an electric grinder but I knew that going in. This is a great hand grinder!

Seems well made. Very attractive design. Fit and finish of all parts well done. Upon arrival I made 2 pots of coffee, one Bodum French Press with a course grind, and one Bodum Pour-over with a medium grind. Both tasted great. I was able to easily adjust the coarseness of the grind for both types. You can safely believe the high ratings on this product.

Its easy to assemble and grinds the beans perfectly. Very nice well made sturdy grinder and very nice sleek design. Easy to clean and stores easy out of the way. It works so much better than any one I have ever had! Grinds better than the electric one that I have and cleans so much easier as well. I highly recommend this grinder its amazing!

This is an awesome little coffee grinder. It’s super easy to use, compact, lightweight, yet built to last. You can tell that’s it’s built with longevity in mind. It doesn’t take long to grind an AeroPress amount of coffee, maybe 1-2 minutes depending on how strong you drink it. I like that it’s ceramic so the beans don’t get overheated while grinding. Would buy again! Probably will buy some for gifts in the future!
Better than I expected!

reviews.reviewTitle: My first coffee grinder and I am in love
reviews.reviewText: After holding onto a bag of Capis Coffee beans that I was given almost a year ago as a gift, I finally decided to pick up a coffee grinder to make them and I couldn't be happier. This little guy is the perfect size for me because I live in a studio apartment and only ever need to make one cup of coffee at a time. I use a single serving French Press and this coffee grinder makes a little more than just enough for one large (12 oz) cup of coffee. It's super easy to use, doesn't take up much space on my counter, and it's simple and easy to clean. I cannot recommend this grinder enough!

I have used French presses for a while now, and I have had to have Starbucks or Costco grind my coffee beans for me. Thus leaving my coffee stale faster and inconvenient having to get my grounds ground at a store. This grinder is so easy to use, even my husband is excited to make our coffee! We can definitely taste the freshness. I hesitated to buy it, but I am glad that I did. Coffee never tasted so good.

I was actually expecting this to be little bigger. However for the little handheld thing it's actually a very powerful and accurate grinder. It was simple and easy to use and I can definitely change the course of the coffee grounds. Now instead of repeatedly going to my local supermarket, I can just enjoy grinding the coffee by myself at home.

This coffee grinder is light and compact so it's great for traveling or camping, but it also grinds nicer than my electric grinder, so I may use it at h ok me as well. I like that it has the ability to adjust between course and fine. I was able to grind coffee for both a coffee maker and an espresso maker with success.

reviews.reviewTitle: Coffee grinder - neat lines, easy to use
reviews.reviewText: This very simple coffee grinder is easy to use with the size just right to hold in place while grinding the coffee. The design is very modern allowing a neat, clean look if left on the counter. The handle design is clever to avoid rotating the wrong way yet very ergonomic. I am very pleased with the purchase.

reviews.reviewTitle: Morning coffee and exercise all in one!
reviews.reviewText: Great. Morning coffee and exercise all in one. But seriously, very well made. Everything seals very tightly keeping your ground coffee fresh in the bottom and whole beans fresh in the top. You definitely feel the forearm burn while cranking but maybe it makes the coffee taste better if you have to work for it 🤷‍♀️ Very consistent grind and easily change grind setting by simply turning the mechanism. Highly recommend!

This is just what you need to grind your own whole bean coffee. It can be adjusted to grind fine or medium. I've been using it all summer and so far, it seems to be holding up. It is pretty easy to clean. This one was in my price range. You can spend a lot on a burr grinder. This one does just fine for me.

Upon receiving and using this grinder I discovered new things about grinders, coffee, and even myself.

I got this because the electric grinder keeps getting kidnapped by my roommate, and I don't like to buy ground coffee. Turns out that I wasn't grinding my coffee fine enough with the electric grinder. Being a massive amateur, I had no idea how much of an impact the fineness of coffee can make. I'm pretty sure I just sucked at using the electric grinder too, however, this portable boi grinds coffee quite uniformly, with an impressive range of coarseness customization.
Also, I've found that I really enjoy grinding my coffee by hand; it makes me feel closer to the coffee (If that makes any sense).
TL;DR GRANTS YOU POWER OVER COFFEE BEANS! Great bang for you buck.

This is a great little coffee grinder if you need something portable in a pinch. I wouldn't really recommend it for large grinding needs. It grinds it pretty much all the same, maybe just a slight difference in fineness, but it takes so much arm power it is great for one or two cups but not more. It is easy to assemble and use!

So for $25 this little grinder is amazing! It has a ceramic conical burr, which is the best for grinding. The grind settings are very versatile as can be seen in my photo. I often enjoy Turkish coffee and my electric grinder doea not grind fine enough. Fine grinding is no problem for this grinder. With some practice with the settings you can adjust to any desired grind. The burr is easily removed for cleaning. This grinder is perfect for the kitchen or camping.

I use this to grind spices instead of coffee beans. Though it is manual it gives you two frank options for coarse or more fiber and I like being in control instead of the grinder quickly pulverizing my spices. My spices are light so I’m not sure how the manual crank would be for hard coffee beans but this is well made and sleek.

Ummmm- where do I begin? This is a great little grinder but you may die of caffeine withdrawal by the time you grind enough for a cup. Mind you, THE RESULTS ARE PERFECT but this is not the grinder to reach for when you are in a hurry. 'Went back to using my electric grinder. Connoisseurs will be pleased if they are patient.
Omg, this is incredible I can actually make so great coffee now

reviews.reviewTitle: Sleek, well constructed, won't take up space in the kitchen
reviews.reviewText: Bought this so I can have more control over my coffee grind because the electric grinder I've been using (an all purpose grinder) is impossible to get a slightly coarse grind with. Also, I just like the practice of hand grinding a small amount of coffee for that days cup instead of feeling obligated to do multiple days worth with the electric grinder (hassle the dig out, plug in, etc). Nicely packaged and works really well!

reviews.reviewTitle: Simple and effective, exactly why I bought this grinder
reviews.reviewText: I realized that to get a better result from my french press, I needed to look into a burr grinder to use with my beans. Since I was not looking to spend $100 for a reliable electric grinder, this was the best option I landed on. It feels tight and snug when put together, and when putting in the force required to grind the beans, it feels solid the whole way through. My first grind was with some Tim Horton's beans I just bought, and even though I didn't get the grounds-water ratio correct, the coffee is already much better (less muddy and murky tasting) than before. For this price, and for a lifetime warranty, it can't be beat.

This is the first coffee grinder I ever purchased so I don't have much to compare it to. But I will say that for me, it serves its purpose well. It is definitely adjustable but as mentioned earlier, I can't compare it to other grinders so maybe in the grand scheme of things it doesn't give much variety. I will say that I brewed cold brew with coarser grounds and it worked pretty well but usually I have it on a much finer setting for my daily cup. I probably don't do a great job of cleaning it but that's just a personal thing. When I do clean it, it's pretty easy to do!

This product is very straightforward. There are visual ques on the product that help you understand when the part are locked together. It would be practically impossible to get hurt while using this product. I like that I have more control over how much coffee I grind with this product compared to a typical coffee grinder. The bottom clear base is a thick plastic, so if they were to change that to glass it would be more sustainable. Overall, a good product. I would recommended it to a friend that was just getting into grinding their own coffee.
It works great and small enough for travel

I really like this small hand held coffee grinder. It’s easy to use, is simple to clean up and takes up very little space. It’s a little extra work to manually grind the beans but I’ve found that I can get it done in the amount of time it takes for the water to heat up. Great product!
Really loved it .Its a nice coffee grinder very easy to use and clean id recommend to everyone

I really like that it has a ceramic burr to grind the beans. I hear that's the best way to do it. Everything on it is very well made and fits snugly. I like that. The coffee was delicious and we could smell it brewing upstairs. It's true that grinding it really opens up the oils in the coffee beans and let's out the flavor. We will also use it on the road. I felt it was easy to grind the beans and it only took a minute or two to grind enough to brew a 12 cup coffee pot. I'd much rather grind it manually than have to listen to that awful electric grinder noise either late at night prepping for the next day or early in the morning. Easy to clean too.
The product is easy to use and clean , really helpful to make asst coffe in the morning
Great product this is the only manual grinder I have owned that has a consistent grind
This is great for traveling. Lightweight and doesn't take up much room.

I honestly was surprised at how it arrived I didn’t imagine the grinder to be so light and simple to use. Of course it doesn’t grind as much at a time but it gets the job done and easy to clean!! Makes my coffee tastes fresher than when I buy it out of a bag. I love that it’s easy to take for traveling because some locations don’t have coffee makers so this allows me to have fresh coffee on the go
It does what it says it does

I was given some amazing Vietnamese coffee beans and realized I needed a coffee grinder. I purchased this because it looks very nice and seems like easy to use. I like this alot! Finally got myself this after all these years. I will now be able to enjoy some of the coffee beans I got from christmas xD finally..
Tried several other grinders but this one has the best quality for this price range. Easy to adjust and use.

reviews.reviewTitle: Worth the price, works very well.
reviews.reviewText:
Im on a coffee adventire of late, trying new brew methods, devices and as such need to adjust the grind. Bought this for its compact size and ceramic grinder parts.

It works as described. Hand grinding is always...a...um...well a grind, but its meditative.

reviews.reviewTitle: Ok if electric isn’t an option
reviews.reviewText: It takes forever to grind enough for one cup. Not practical at all for everyday use. But I would recommend it if you’re traveling of otherwise can plug in an electric grinder. The grind is also pretty inconsistent. You can adjust it but it still gives an inconsistent grind.
Just used a few times since it arrived and I am very happy with the grinder, ease of use and sturdy.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use, gets the job done, but takes a long time to dry after cleaning
reviews.reviewText: Just got my coffee grinder! It works great so far. Its definitely a slower process than my old cheap automatic grinder but that one broke and I dont really have the money to get a fancy $100 plus bur grinder, so this works just fine in its place. The only thing that is a little annoying is cleaning it. I cleaned it in the morning and left it out to dry but by the next morning when I needed to use it, it was still a little wet. And obviously I cant have it wet at all for my coffee grinds so i had to use a blowdryer to dry it which is a little annoying.

reviews.reviewTitle: Sleek design with a smooth crank
reviews.reviewText: I use this to grind course grinds into finer grinds that allow me to use for my espresso maker & percolator. With this motive, I have only used it for fine grinds. the grind for course to fine is very smooth and powdery and seems to be consistent. The sleek design and foldable crank make for some nice space saving and storage. This manual grinder comes with a lifetime warranty (hopefully I don't need it anytime soon). I have yet to clean it since I just received it. There are no explicit instructions on care and cleaning aside from "we recommend to keep it clean and dislodge any beans that are stuck"

This coffee grinder has a huge range from Expresso to French Press. It’s extremely easy to use even on the finest settings. It seems to have nice high quality burrs. The construction feels very sturdy with a stainless steel body. The grind holder is made from plastic. But it seems to be a high-quality and durable plastic at that. The handle is also stainless steel with a very smooth spin and grind. The foldable handle is definitely a nice touch for travel, dorms etc. I would definitely recommend it! For travel or for every day use.
So my conclusion is it’s definitely a high-quality grinder for a great price! Five stars!

Not exceptional coffee grounds but it works well considering the price. Some of the other grinders I've tried around this price range give much more inconsistent grounds so I can't complain. The handle is way too small though and is quite uncomfortable to use street s little while.

reviews.reviewTitle: Coffee tastes great with this grinder
reviews.reviewText: I like to make espresso in the morning and require a fine grind. This conical burr grinder does a nice job. Just be aware that you have to commit 5-10 min to hand grinding, which I see as a form of morning exercise. If you get up and are in a hurry, you should invest in the electric version.

Not worth the effort, takes forever to grind! Save some money and buy another electric grinder. Not sure how this thing gets all the positive reviews, I used mine a couple times and put it in the good will bag.
Got consistent grind every time and clean up is so easy.

This is my first grinder in general as I'm just delving into the world of coffee, though from the few times I have used it I'm very pleased by it's functional simplicity! I intend to bring it on backpacking trips to make some good quality pour over coffee on the move! Can't wait to use it then after much practice at home. Which it will be my primary grinder at home as of now.

This is a perfect grinder that I have been looking for. I really need it to make a perfect espresso but I can't afford a fancy grinder machine. Reviewed some reviews and decided to give a shot! Arrived on time, tried multiple times but ONLY for the fine one. A little bit confusing on how to operate it at the beginning but a little tweak made it works! Perfect finest for my espresso but a little tricky to clean it, but who cares since I will use it every day :D
I just opened the box today. It's nice and compact. I tested the grinding and it worked well. I was able to easily adjust how big I wanted the grounds. I got it for my french press. So far so good.
Its the perfect size for traveling and its actually a lot sturdier than I thought it would be. It Arrived on time.
Great product work amazing

reviews.reviewTitle: Will not fit in an Aeropress.
reviews.reviewText:
Product works great for travel. I bought it specifically to travel with. I wanted a small compact grinder to use with my Aeropress. I was hoping it would slide into the aeropress, but its just a little too large. Its still a great grinder. adjustments are easy. the grinder is real easy to clean as well.

Overall I am very satisfied with the grinder.

This is a wonderful product!!! I am a coffee fanatic and hand ground beans are the best! This product is easy to use, effectively grinds the beans and you can control your grind size, which I like. Comes apart quite easy for cleaning which is a plus. Great for a gift.

reviews.reviewTitle: The best manual grinder from all I had
reviews.reviewText: Very good quality for the money I paid. Easy to use, I love it!

This item is so nicely built and the perfect size for either travel or for someone who wants to minimize taking up space with kitchen gadgets at home. The grind seems very consistent and the unit is easy to clean. It looks good and works great, what more could you ask for :-)

Ground my coffee well. Doesn’t hold a lot.

For a 5 star rating you can get a free grinder and it genuinely annoys me that a company would specify that they will give you a second specifically for a 5 star review, hence the single star.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use - great for travel
reviews.reviewText: I'm impressed so far. I only need one cup worth of espresso grind now and then. Grinding a large amount ahead of time wastes the good coffee. This is a better alternative, so far! A little cumbersome to assemble every time, but, like I said, I only need one cup of espresso every now and then.
Loved it!! Would definitely recommend..was very easy and smooth to use
The grinder is exactly what I wanted. It is well made and performs very well. I recommend this product.
Works great!

Every brewing style requires a different type of ground. A lot of the automatic grinders don’t provide a consistent ground of coffee. A manual coffee grinder is for the true coffee enthusiast who enjoys a consistent cup of coffee. I import my beans, so every bean counts. I found this grinder, after I played with the knob to get the desired ground, it has been the most consistent for my type of brewing method. You truly can’t beat it for the price. The only thing missing is a carry pouch. However, that’s a nice-to-have.
A perfect grinder for making that quick cup of coffee. Works very efficiently and no effort to clean it. It would also be very handy for travel too.
I like the collapsing arm. It’s a good fit on the trail or in the kitchen

Easy/Intuitive to use. Can accurately adjust grind size. I've only had it for a few days, so cannot make a comment about durability, but I don't anticipate early breakage. I used a permanent marker to draw a line on the receptacle part indicating the perfect amount to grind for my Aeropress coffee maker.

I love this grinder. It is compact enough to not take up space in my cabinet and is used regularly. I have had no issue cleaning it and it’s been a little while since my order and has held up nicely. Great for the price point and I recommend for sure.

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect size for travel add AeroPress
reviews.reviewText: Just received this to compliment my new AeroPress. So handy and easy to use. Finally, I can grind a great cup of coffee at work or on the road. The attached plastic jar is handy, and the capacity (about 19g) is perfect for the AeroPress. Highly recommend this product!
It works great and it doesn't take much space away. We love fresh grinded coffee in the french press. It's not hard to grind with it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Makes great coffee taste even better with a consistent grind!
reviews.reviewText: Easy to use, clean, and travel with. The triangular body is comfortable in the hand. I found drip coffee grind is nine clicks out from all the way in (9 clicks out from finest grind setting). Compared it with locally ground coffee and it’s on point. Good for making 5 cups of coffee at a time—if you need to grind more, an electric or combo unit would be more ideal. For pour overs or small pots of coffee, this is perfect. Easy to clean as well which is a bonus, especially over the electric counter parts.
It’s very fancy looking, easy to use, easy to clean. If you like that nice fresh grind then this is for you. Might even work for weed too.

I just received it and I'm cannot be any happier!!! I immediately noticed it's great quality and easy to take care of. Perfect for when I'm traveling and I want my coffee grinded for an espresso on the go. The top is made of steel and the bottom part of sturdy plastic. I know it'll last me and for the price it was well worth it.
Took forever to grind a spoonful of flax seeds. Adjusting settings did nothing. Would not grind garlic at all. I did not try coffee but I just thought it didn't work well, despite looking nice.
Great for my camper. Easy to use and gets thr job done. Even works for spices.

reviews.reviewTitle: I used this to grind flour
reviews.reviewText: Solid sturdy item used for grinding Teff flour vs coffee. Spin item clockwise for finer grind and counter clockwise for courser grind. I will also use this to process mesquite pods which are similar to coffee beans. Wish me luck.

Amazing coffee grinder. I have been looking for a small portable coffee grinder and I am glad, I bought this coffee grinder. It's a cute, simple and portable coffee grinder. So easy to use and grinds the beans perfectly. And get fresh coffee wherever you go.

This grinder is making me happy! It's easy for me to use even at my age. I love fresh ground coffee and this grinder allows me to choose how fine I want it. I use it at home and take it with me when traveling, so simple to pack away until needed. This is a great buy!

I tried several grinds and it was impressive. Pot after pot of coffee was delicious. I used the collection cup as a scoop and poured into the grinder area. Adjusted the grind from coarse to fine it did the job. I got a work out too.

Love this grinder as it is easy to travel with.. Fits nicely in suitcase.. It is a manual grinder, but grinds the beans exactly as I like!! This unit is relatively easy to clean as well!!! Great value!! I take it on all my travels!

This grinder works really well! I love it for its sturdiness and compact size (you can easily bring this when traveling). I enjoy hand grinding coffee beans myself and this grinder works perfectly for it. It’s exactly what I needed! I’d recommend it.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is going in the travel trailer
reviews.reviewText:
I love that this is manual and portable. Will definitely be having some great coffee in the mountains!! We camp allot and we want good coffee!! We are glampers 😁 and proud of it!!
Absolutely going to be grinding our beans!
It’s easy to use and adjust. Consistent, also.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very practical and easy to use
reviews.reviewText:
I prefer this manual grinder over any automatic coffee grinding machine .
You can start using the grinder right out of the box . I recommend washing the grinder before using it .
It’s small in size which fits perfectly in my kitchen cabinet

It’s fairly intuitive and easy to use. Requires one muscle but who couldn’t use a little exercise every morning?! Happy with the product.

Make sure to adjust the grind setting as it came defaulted to the finest setting, which was way too small for a coffee maker (plus it takes longer to grind!).

reviews.reviewTitle: Rice flour and sort of matcha
reviews.reviewText: Awesome coffee grinder! So far I've used to make some rice flour, grind some pepper flakes, and attempted to make my own match from green tea lol. Grinder did exactly as promised. It's easy to use and clean. For a manual grinder, I really like it.
Smooth, good Measure for 2 coffies

First off I want to say thanks to the seller because when my first packaged it arrived empty. Item came out of packaging during shipment. And seller quickly sent out another. So far the coffee grinder works perfectly just what I needed.

I found the design of the folding handle stores well. The quick disconnect (about 10 deg rotation) of the top crank for filling with beans and the bottom grounds container have a very nice detent that seem well engineered. The crank has some resistance so cranking is exercise. I never owned a grinder before so it was a little bit disappointing to spend 90 seconds grinding to get enough grounds for one strong cup of coffee. However there is nothing smells better than fresh grounds. Opt for a powered grinder if you make coffee by the pot.

Hey I wasn't sure if I"d like this but I'm enjoying my new grinder.
