I love this grinder! It is very easy to use and so portable.
It does what it's supposed to do and it works good.
Cute and comfortable and easy to use
It is very easy to use, the quality was good
I just love it.
Works great and as expected
Awesome travel size grinder
Great

I love how small the product is, i originally thought it was going to be a lot larger but it is the perfect size to take with you on business or leisure trips and don't want to drink hotel or mc donalds coffee. The bottom container is plastic so it is safe to put in a suitcase if needed, i thought it was glass. The grinder has different settings for how fine or coarse you would like your coffee ground. This makes a difference when using a french press, coffee maker, percolator, pour over etc. I really like this little added feature because with most coffee grinders you do not get this option to choose how fine you want your grounds, unless youre at the grocery store and use their machine or have a high class coffee grinders at home. I also love the fact its quiet unlike a electric grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect travel size grinder for coffee lovers
reviews.reviewText: It grinds coffee beans perfectly. It is Adjustable to change different grind setting Yes, one can 'turn' the dial and 'adjust' the size. But I hope you're only seeking a very similar range of sizes on the fine side. If you want espresso ground coffee, I can't recommend this grinder highly enough. It will powder your coffee very quickly. To achieve a grind sufficiently coarse one must loosen the grinding mechanism. It's perfect for traveling and for a home easy to clean.
I loved everything about this product it was easy to clean and did everything I needed it to do. It definitely exceeded my expectations. would buy again!

My daughter is a barista at a well known coffeehouse and often sends me bags of coffee knowing how much I love my coffee. Now I can ask her to send the whole beans and really enjoy the flavors. This grinder is just right in every way. I'm impressed with how sleek it looks as well. So happy I made this purchase.
I dislike being bribed for a 5-star rating in an email that revealed MANY other customer e-mail addresses to me.

DO NOT BUY. Seller promises warranty, extra gift cards, and an extra grinder if you give them a 5 star review. ALL of the 5 star reviews are bought. The grinder itself is mediocre. It grinds. It also takes me 10 minutes of grinding to get enough coffee to make a cup. And I'm a well built 200lbs human male.

Like everything else in the world. China in the form of someone that contacts you via an email address with the name Yang Amanda (eye roll at getting the surname and first name wrong when they set it up) wheroamoz@gmail.com demanding you gift them screenshots of your fake 5 star review you gave them. They never had any intention of giving anyone a giftcard or extra grinder. They're just promising such so they can sell as much of this knock-off grinder they can in the dead of night and move on the next product some second-rate chinese factory puts out too many of.

reviews.reviewTitle: Dishonest company extorts five star reviews from customers
reviews.reviewText:
Be forewarned that many of these five-star reviews were solicited by the supplier. I was really excited to get my hands on a good quality!manual bur grinder that was the right size for a single or double cup of espresso. I was especially pleased that I would not have to spend tons of money to get a five-star reviewed model. I realize heavily on other consumer reviews when I'm deciding on purchases and have found in the past people to be pretty honest when they love a product they say so if they take the time to leave a negative review it's generally because the product inconvenienced or bothered them enough with it's features (or lack thereof) to try to help other consumers make educated purchases. I found it on when I open the package that there was a card inside appearing to tempt the buyer with a "free gift" "all" they had to do was "leave a five-star review."

I gave two stars because using it is pretty simple and I do enjoy smelling my coffee while I'm hand-grinding it. It also gives it pretty consistent size ground. That's where the compliments end. Unless you were looking to grind 5 to 10 beans at a time and waste a good portion of beans that would not grind enough to pass through the burrs on the fine setting- which is the suggested setting for espresso- I recommend literally any other model grinder. Super disappointing that a company is allowed to farm for five star likes with the lure of the free gift. Extremely dishonest. Do not recommend.

reviews.reviewTitle: This Is An Awesome Manual/Hand Grinder
reviews.reviewText:
Update: My below review stands. However, this company entices you with a 2nd "free" grinder... in exchange for a 5 star, positive review. The below review was a 5 🌟, until now. Never received 2nd grinder after numerous email exchanges with vendor. Scummy tactic. This UPDATE stands until further notice.:--:--:
This is a well built product that is easy to use. Very convenient to adjust and clean. This is a vital part of my french press kit (grinder, scale, press, kettle, mug [propane stove]) that will allow me to make perfect coffee during a power outage, during hurricane season.

Awful, awful product. First there's the build quality, it looks nice on puctures but the handle is completely loose, also the grinder itself does a very poor job on actually grinding the beans, no matter the granularity settings. It will take you hundreds of turns to get something out of it.

I personally used it once, hated it, thought about returning it, forgot about it, and now I'm stuck with another piece of useless kitchenware.

Avoid this if you can, best free advice I can give you

Bought this due to the reviews, but ended up returning it. Reviews said that the grounds were much more consistent, but I didn't find that to be the case.

You can adjust the grinder to get the grind as coarse or fine as you want, but they weren't all the same size. Takes a while to grind them as well. Wife used it and was getting tired as she ground just enough beans for a single serving. We ground a small amount and it took longer than expected.

I guess if you travel and absolutely must grind your own coffee, this would be ok since it's compact. But I don't travel with a coffee grinder, so I'll look for one that grinds better/faster and is easier to use.

i recently came back from Jamaica and purchase Marley Coffee "Talkin' Blues" whole coffee beans - this is the most expensive coffee i've ever bought - 30USD for 12 oz of whole coffee beans - there are so many brands - i don't even know if this "Talkin' Blues" is legit or if not real blue mtn coffee - that's for another review.

anyway i needed a coffee grinder - i had been using ground coffee (fine ground) in my bodum single cup french press. i had bought some cheap whole bean coffee (Tim Horton's medium blend whole bean) to practice my skills with the new coffee bean grinder before i use it on the expensive stuff.

i received the grind in fast and perfect condition - there are not much instruction in terms of taking it apart and cleaning - it's not entirely aluminum - the crank appears to be aluminum - the screw top with threads that hold the grinder handle in place appears to be aluminum. the body of grinder is plastic wrapped with aluminum. the bottom that catches the coffee grounds is clear plastic. the burr itself is ceramic as advertised.

it's a bit top heavy - kinda wish they would balance it from top to bottom and not make it so top heavy. the aluminum picks up fingerprints like crazy.

at the bottom of the grind right before the mill attaches itself to the clear coffee container there is a screw in part holds the ceramic burr in place - this is where you make the adjustment for fine to coarse - i had accidentally adjusted it too much at that piece fell off. i needed a coarse grind - but i think i got a medium coarse grind out of it which i'm OK with. there was little silt left at the bottom of the coffee cup with my 2nd cup of coffee using this grinder - it is much better than using ground coffee where it left basically mud at the bottom. there is no indicator of how fine or coarse your grounds will be you just have test it. i don't know anything about coffee grinder as this is my first but there isn't a fine adjustment where you actually can dial in the kind of grind you want - again you'll just have to test it.

while there is some info on how to grind- there isn't any info on how to take it apart - but it is easier to destroy than to create -- easy to take apart but if you don't know where the parts go i can see you spending some time figuring out how to put it back together.

the package says lifetime warranty - the warranty is as good as how long the company lasts - there's no lifetime warranty if it goes out of business or decides to change their name.

i bought this for 15 and change - i think anything over that is prob over paying. that being said it's a good grinder for single cup or perhaps 2 cups. definitely can travel with it and you'll earn your cup of coffee as this grind is manual. good for the traveler and appears to be well built so far.

thanks for reading

This is a versatile grinder, for home, travel, vacation, camping. Wherever you might need fresh ground coffee or spices if this is your need. It is compact, sleek and best of all, easy to clean. Comes apart to rinse and dry. It has adjustable settings for your type of grind. We like a more fine grind and it was just as easy to manually grind coffee beans for espresso as it was for regular drip grind. I'll put this on my gift list for birthday/holiday gift giving as the price is definitely worth the value.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great device but no instructions regarding disassembly for cleaning. Here's how I cleaned it.
reviews.reviewText:
The grinder itself is excellent, but I took off a star because they did not include *any* instructions regarding how the device should be cleaned. It was not difficult to figure out, but I wasted significant time looking for that information online, in order to avoid possibly damaging the device in the course of disassembling it.

I wanted to clean the device before using it for the first time, as I have no way of knowing whether it was created and packaged in a clean environment.

To clean it, I ended up doing the following:

* Twist the clear chamber on the bottom to unlock it, and remove it from the body.
* While holding the crank in place, use fingers to unscrew the plastic fastener that controls the coarseness of the grind until it comes off. Be careful because it is spring-loaded.
* Place the removed fastener to one side, remembering its orientation.
* Remove the ceramic internal grinding part that was under the fastener. Be careful because it is spring-loaded. Place it to one side, remembering its orientation.
* Remove the lock washer that is under the grinding part and place it to one side, remembering its orientation.
* Unscrew the cylindrical threaded cap on top completely.
* Remove the crank handle.
* Clean each part with dishwashing liquid and water. Be careful with the inner and outer ceramic grinding parts, as they are very abrasive, and also, quite breakable if they are dropped.
* When finished, re-assemble everything as it was before by reversing the order of the above steps. Be especially careful when pushing the bottom plastic fastener onto the spring-loaded inner ceramic grinding part; pressure must be maintained against the spring while turning until the thread engages.
* Turn the bottom plastic fastener clockwise to attain the proper degree of fineness for the grind that you intend to create.

I'll note that another reviewer said that she avoided the detailed disassembly by just removing the two ends of the device and then cleaning the clear plastic receiving chamber and rinsing through the central shaft. I did not try that; it might work OK and thus avoid a lot of effort.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does Exactly What I Need it to Do
reviews.reviewText:
I like to grind my own coffee beans each morning. Yes, I think it makes coffee taste better, but I also find the process somehow therapeutic. Taking time to grind the beans helps me get focused for the day and map out my daily plan. Not really a function of this coffee grinder, but it's the reason I use the grinder.

I have an electric grinder, but it's loud and isn't great for grinding one cup's worth of beans. If I need to grind a lot a time, then the electric works well, but this manual grinder is quick, quiet and easy to use for a single cup. Plus I can easily throw it in my bag along with a handful of beans and I can make coffee when I travel!

As for the grinder itself, I find the quality very good. I really like that the top cap and bottom cup both lock into place. No issues with them popping open during grinding and spilling grounds everywhere. It's easy to adjust the grind and I find that this grinder will grind extremely fine if I'm using my Aeropress, or very course if I'm using a French Press. It obviously will do any grind in between too.

It's a simple device, easy to use and does exactly what I want it do to. Construction is sturdy and should last a long time. At this price, I'd definitely buy again if I lost, broke or somehow damaged this unit. I have no issues throwing it in my suitcase for travel. Fits my needs.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great all around! Easy to use and clean.
reviews.reviewText: We buy whole beans for our coffeemaker at home. I nanny and they don’t have a coffee maker. I use a pour over system, but don’t get the same quality with ground coffee I buy. This has changed the game. I’m able to grind my beans and have great coffee while I work. The grinder is Stainless Steel and ceramic stones; great quality. I plan on making my own cold brew and have read that this grinder helps make the perfect grind. I also have seen that this is great for grinding spices. I’m very happy with it.

Durable stainless steel grinder with a ceramic grinding core, it can grind for any brew, Easy to clean and grind
Plus its compact design makes it fit pretty much anywhere.

reviews.reviewTitle: Consistent Grind for the freshest coffee!
reviews.reviewText:
As a coffee enthusiasts for decades, I appreciate a nifty grinder like this!
It creates a consistent grind for your coffee.
PROS:
* Ceramic Burr - easily grinds beans for the best taste
* folding handle - Makes it easy for travel AND no more losing the handle like other designs!
* LOCKS! the chamber locks into place so you don't have to worry about the containers coming apart or dropping (which is a problem of other designs). The handle top locks into place as well.
* See Thru chamber - this is MY FAVORITE feature. Especially after you clean or adjust your grinder, you need to check the grind to adjust for course or fine. So CONVENIENT!

CONS:
Reassembly: There is not simple way to remember how to reassemble the unit when you take it apart. I highly recommend you take a video of yourself as you take it apart or at least take photographs along the way. If you’re not paying attention or are not mechanicall inclined.

CONCLUSION:
This is a great grinder unit that has two advantages over competitors: The see thru chamber and the locks so it doesn’t come apart during use or travel.
The reassembly could be fine tuned with either writing down and drawing your own diagram, but if you do it enough, it becomes easier. Most grinders will require cleaning at least once a week to maintain cleanliness and purity of flavor as old grind and beans can go rancid and taint the flavor

I just received this today. I did the recommended test grind and it worked well. I didn't turn the little knob on the crank because the fine grounds are perfect for us. It can be set to coarse or fine. I purchased without the lifetime warranty, and I would recommend it. I might add, there are three parts to it. The top you turn right to open the top. The bottom (where the arrows are) turn right to open. Put the beans in the middle section, attach the top then attach the clear plastic catcher. It's not difficult to figure out, but those instructions aren't in there. It will grind 20 gms of beans, which turns out to be 4 scoops (we use five for ten mugs of coffee, so that's a downside, not enough to take a star though). The only concern I have is the plastic for the grinder itself. Which is why I am going to get the lifetime warranty. We have rolling blackouts coming our way through the fire season, and I am stocking up on *things that will make my life easier* i.e. the coffee grinder and a few other items.

With my Coleman grill and camp set, I'll never worry about running out of daily coffee. Also, this travel well. I will check in after a month and update on the plastic grinder portion.

reviews.reviewTitle: Big on features, small on price and space needed for storage
reviews.reviewText: I love this item. I am getting into grinding my own coffee & have been looking for a nice manual grinder. I wanted an electric one initially, but I didn't want to spend $100 bucks for a decent one, & I don't want something that will take up valuable real estate on my counter. This item fits the bill nicely. This grinder is adjustable & takes a little messing around to find your preferred setting, but once you find it, you'll know. The only issue I have had, is when using different flavored coffees, the flavor can sometimes get trapped. I spoke with my coffee guru who recommended taking some dry rice & grinding it through. This trick works well & also helps to clean the grinder as well. The only issue/concern I have is that I have never owned a different grinder, so I cannot comment on it's quality/skill versus other grinders. All I can say is that this fits my needs perfectly, works well for my purpose, & is very reasonably priced. I have used this iteI love this item. Highly recommended!

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect one cup manual coffee grinder.
reviews.reviewText: This is an awesome grinder. My husband drinks coffee from a French press and he hates using his electric grinder in the morning because it wakes the kids. This is perfect to manually grind enough coffee beans for one cup. We will also be taking it on our camping trips for sure because it doesn't use electricity. It is also compact and not bulky, so it can sit on our kitchen counter and not take up a lot of space.

I got a drip coffee maker the other day and needed a grinder. This one is affordable and easy to use for a newbie. I was able to grind the beans quickly to the size I want and brew a fresh cup of coffee daily in the morning even when I’m in a rush. This comes in handy and also easy to clean. I like how well made it looks and it also appears very durable. I have it out on the counter and it’s quick to grab and grind.

I purchased the Wheroamoz Manual Coffee Grinder for coffee and it worked great but I also found it grinds eggshells perfectly too, which I put the powder on my dog's food.
Eggshells are especially good for her. Coffee for me, eggshells for her, and the Wheroamoz Manual Coffee Grinder is the perfect choice for me, for us. It is perfect for when we travel, especially when we go camping and don't have the use of electricity. It is also very easy to clean. I highly recommend the Wheroamoz Manual Coffee Grinder as it is a great gadget to own. We love it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Adjustment does nothing and takes forever for even a small amount
reviews.reviewText: I thought a non-electric grinder might be the way to go BUT NO! It took forever to grind even a small amount, and the option to make it more coarse did nothing. I returned this.

reviews.reviewTitle: Quality, Fits hand perfectly, Consistent Grind
reviews.reviewText: After comparing all of the manual grinders I picked this particular model. I like the clear container at the bottom to catch the grounds. I was pleased to see this isn't round but triangular shape which fits the hand much better then one thats perfectly round. The handle and grinder mechanism works as smoothly as desired and most importantly its extremely consistent in grinding coffee. I have a French press, a piston type press and recently a pour over carafe dripper and each uses a different grind and with this I can keep my beans fresh and use them and grind accordingly. For the price, this is great quality and most important of all is its consistent in grinding coffee as you want it... FYI the pour over Carafe with a stainless steel mesh provides the smoothest coffee I ever made.

I'm not sure who really needs to bring their own grinder with them while traveling but if you truly need to, this is a good one to have. It's quite compact, so it can be stored virtually anywhere in your kitchen. The grinding function is simple enough, one direction for smoother grinding, the other for a more clumped sort of powder. This also comes fully assembled, which is a plus. The instructions included are easy to understand and cleanup is very simple; just add a bit of water and soap and give it a few shakes, then rinse, and you're ready to use once more.

I just received this manual grinder and it’s awesome. It is easy to assemble, easy to clean and it holds just enough ground coffee. The manual’s instructions on adjusting the settings for how coarse you want your beans ground was good and the dial didn’t stick after adjustment. I find holding it in my hands to grind the beans more effective than putting it on the table. Great addition to coffee and tea supplies I carry especially when traveling.
Purchased on a refund promo and then they didn't follow through.

I originally got this for me but my daughter fell in love and snagged it from me almost as soon as I got it out of the package. Extremely well made and love the sleek design of it.And so far she hasn't worn it out grinding everything in sight so an even bigger plus it holds up to her coffee addiction very well.Its the perfect weight for me when I get to put my hands on it and works very smoothly.Definite keeper if I can snag it back from my daughter lol.

i love this coffee grinder! its such a blessing, it works really well. i make in a french press and also have a regular coffee pot , and i can get a good grind for each using this awesome little grinder. It holds enough ground coffee to make a 12 cup pot of coffee as well ( witch the electric grinder i had didnt).

This is a nice compact manual coffee grinder. The design is super sleek and very easy to take apart to wash. I not only used this to grind coffee, but also tried crushing peanuts and roasted cashews and it worked like a charm! This will not mill it to a powder which is perfect because for coffee, I need bigger granules! Highly recommend this!

Bought for work along with a pour over pot so I can custom brew my coffee. The burr type grind is better than blender blade type grinders ro retain oils from the coffee bean. Handled folds inward for convenient storage in my desk. Also bought reusable K-cups that I can use my grinds in for custom coffee at fraction of cost. This one is better than an old one I had that the handle kept comming off to store and would slip off while turning to grind.

I got this grinder for grinding coffee beans as well as some dry spices and must say that it does it’s job wonderfully. Very small and compact to store. Easy to use and easy to clean. Truly a handy instrument for kitchen as well as outdoors. I love it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great buy, for enjoying variety coffee
reviews.reviewText:
I was using ole traditional grinding method but was time consuming and cleaning was the difficult process. So, it was time to replace my vintage coffee grinder So i took a look at Wheroamoz Manual Coffee Grinder made of stainless steel with strong blade. Now i can try different types of coffee beans to make variety of coffee like Star Bucks do. Very good and extremely quiet i used mine so far to ground and it had no problem grinding them to powder in about 60 seconds. Cleaning is very easy. Some time I can boil complete unite to make more clear.
Really enjoying my coffee.

So I am new to the whole coffee business, but apparently the better coffees are the ones you grind yourself. So when looking for a grinder, I looked for one that was reliable, simple to use and easy to clean. This Grinder boated all of theSe. I absolutely love this grinder

Love the grinder. This is one of my first pieces to my new coffee corner. So I am no expert, but the grinder is easy to use, took a min to see how it works, again as a beginner to the coffee world very happy with the product. I am curious if any one can shine some light on how to clean it, am I missing something. Are you expose to clean the inside of the grinder mechanism? And if you are looking to grind fine!!! This definitely gets the job done as I only plan on making espresso like coffee. But also enjoy that I can also use the coarse grind for baking purposes!!!! So far I have been able to make coffee chocolate cake and coffee flavored ice cream...yum yum yum!

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use and open, stays attached while grinding
reviews.reviewText: I have used other coffee grinders both manual and electric and this by far the easiest to use. The handle even tucks in at the top for more compact storage. A quick quarter turn and it is disassembled. The JavaPress one is only fitted on and after multiple uses it comes loose and all of the grounds ended up on the floor, but not with this one. It stays attached. Well worth the price!

reviews.reviewTitle: I don't regret my choice so far.
reviews.reviewText: I like this grinder. It's manual so it's gonna take a bit of muscle to do a whole bag but that's okay. We just bought it because sometimes people give us whole beans because they don't have a grinder so I figured it'd be good to just have a small one on hand just in case. It can take quite a while to grind a whole bag; set down to your favorite news channel or something cuz you'll be working on it for about a half hour. That being said, it actually grinds really well and it's proper adjustable in the middle so that's all you need really.

reviews.reviewTitle: The Triangular Shape makes it easier to hold
reviews.reviewText:
I like that this product locks and unlocks in place. Because it is rounded triangular in shape, it's easier to hold while cranking. The clear plastic canister is easy to clean and I like being able to see the grind easily and adjust.

Update (less than a month later): the plastic canister started developing microscopic cracks near the rim and bottom plastic. These cracks grew and grew into long slashes throughout. I ordered a replacement and will see what happens, but I won't put it in the dishwasher, even though the instructions say the plastic canister is dishwasher safe.

I have only used my new grinder a few times but I'm already impressed by the quality of the look, feel and adjustable grind. This little hand crank grinder feels like its sturdy and well built. The twist off top for beans and bottom grind holder are both easy to twist off and on and have the feel of a well made piece of equipment.
It took me a couple of adjustments to the grind setting on the bottom of the upper part of the grinder to get it set right and in the process I discovered that the range of settings is impressive, from very fine to extremely course. Once I had the grind adjustment set to where I wanted it (a process of trial and adjustment) the process was smooth, quick and the coffee grind was uniform. A pleasure to operate!
I'm taking the grinder camping this weekend and look forward to giving it a try at the camp site.

I am not a coffee drinker and only bought beans for the first time recently to use in my home brewed beer. I also bought this and a French press to have the ability to make coffee for friends. I have used it a few times now and the grinder is great! It takes up as much space as a pepper mill and is easy to use. The beans grind down in just a few seconds and are fully captured by the cup on the bottom of the grinder. Since I am only using it with a French press I have only done coarse grinding, but the adjustment is easy.
I like this one great for traveling works pretty well. Throw in your backpack for fresh ground coffee.

I was using canned espresso for my machine and a friend suggested grinding beans made much better coffee.

This grinder fits the bill nicely. It's well made and operates very smoothly. The grind is easily adjusted to the precise coarseness for making great espresso. The bottom is made of clear plastic material so it is easy to keepp trake of how much coffee is being ground. This bottom detaches with a simple twist so the coffee can be easily transferred to the espresso machine.

I really could not ask for anything better.

I've used this grinder for a week and really like it. It's easy to adjust the grind fine for espresso or coarse for press pot but don't expect to fine tune things. It's perfect for travel when paired with a portable espresso maker. I grind while the portable espresso maker is pre-heating.

I roast my own beans so I also use this to grind for cupping. It's so convenient to grind a small batch and takes about the same amount of time as loading an electric grinder.

Also - exercise makes coffee taste better.

This grinder is slick and compact, easy to use and easy to throw in your suitcase to travel with (maybe a drawstring bag would be helpful to add for that purpose). Grinding coffee doesn’t take a lot of effort and you can easily choose your grind. It works great for my espresso machine, simple percolator and French press.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great to pair with a french press
reviews.reviewText: I lke this coffee grinder very much. It's perfect to take camping and use it with a french press. I usually choose the coarse setting for the french press because the fine coffee is more for an automatic drip machine. The only downside is that it's way slower since you have to turn the knob manually. The grinder is made of pretty good material and it's sturdy.

I love this Manual Coffee Grinder. It's so easy to use. All you have to do is set, load it, and grind it! I'm excited I can have freshly ground coffee while I'm camping or on a road trip. It’s easy to disassemble, clean it and reassemble it. The best part you don't need electricity to use it. I'd definitely recommend!!

GRINDING MY OWN COFFEE. I D NEVER DONE IT BEFORE BUT A FRIEND TOLD ME IT WASNT THAT DIFFICULT. WITH THIS GRINDER, HE WAS RIGHT. EASY TO USE AND SUPER SIMPLE TO CLEAN UP AFTER. I LL PACK THIS WITH ME ON TRIPS.

I really like this little grinder perfect for making just. Small amount like for one pot of coffee or even just enough for one Keurig reusable cup. Fits nearly in the drawer, easy to wash up. Nice finish

Really well made and smarter design than my last manual coffee grinder it replaced. My last one was great (cylinder style all over Amazon) until the burr grinder stem broke. This one has a lifetime warranty, so giving it a shot. It does seem to be high quality, hopefully it lasts longer than the other brand. My only complaint, it doesn’t fit inside my aero press for traveling, but that won’t be relevant for most people. Overall, really nice grinder.

This is a very easy to use compact coffee bean grinder.this coffee grinder hold just the right amount of beans for a couple rounds with a french press or espresso .This hand held burr grinder is very easy to use and it’s so also easy to clean and it is compact you can carry it for travel !!! Loving it ‘I am enjoying using it every day !!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use and perfect grind
reviews.reviewText: I've used various blade grinders and burr grinders, and even used a mortar and pestle to grind my coffee. My biggest complaint with the electric grinders is the mess. The ground coffee seems to pick up a static charge and makes a minor mess. My next biggest complaint is having another gadget sitting on the kitchen counter with a cord getting in the way. I actually like using the mortar and pestle better than any of the electric grinders I've used. This manual grinder from Wheroamoz is my favorite of all the grinders I've used. It is small enough to not get in the way, large enough to grind for a 3 or 4 cup plunge pot, doesn't have a power cord to contend with, the fineness of grind is consistent, and the grinds don't develop a static charge.

I've only had it for a few weeks, but it's worked fine, so far. The only criticism I would have of this model is the design of the settings. There are 4 settings, but they are vaguely marked using round bumps of varying sizes to represent grain size and there is no solid way to know when you switch from one setting to another. I just guessed and it worked out for me, but I feel there should be a click or something to make more clear.

We live in Northern Mexico, and with frequent power outages, we can't use our electric grinder, so no
morning coffee! We grind fresh beans every morning, so with the new manual unit, we have no more outage problem! On vacation trips our camper often has no AC power connection, so once again our new manual grinder saves the day! I like the stainless-steel construction, the tight fits of the removable parts, and the compact size -- particularly for storage in the RV. Thank you, Wheroamoz!
The only bad thing it’s used one not new and the box was open

First thought - aw man! I have to hand grind my beans?

With this, it’s a peaceful ritual every morning grinding those beans. It matches my French press and it looks great. It actually grinds pretty fast, it’s only a few seconds.

I am using it on the medium setting and I find it to be absolutely perfect for my French press.

I also like the folding handle. I suppose it’s quite portable for camping if you wanted to. I got it so I wouldn’t wake up my housemates.

This dose not take up much space and works well for me. My only improvement would be to somehow incorporate a feel or setting for the coarsest grind. I boil the beans which comes out perfectly when using a very coarse grind which is found by twisting the nut to the very last threads before it springs off and disassembles the grinding unit. Top rating for efficiency and value. I shall return if the unit breaks down before 100 uses.

reviews.reviewTitle: Freshly brewed coffee with your handwork
reviews.reviewText: I bought this product because my office doesn’t have freshly brewing . It has Seattle cofee maker which is so bitter . I have my own cofee beans brand which I will get it and grind freshly it does the job . Whenever I need a coffee I will play with this and cofee powder is ready. I did use for pepper it works

It broke down in the first 5 minutes of use, it was very hard to grind and then the plastic connecting the handle to the shaft, The one hidden in upper cover just split in half. I will try to fix it in post an update. Despite the considerable effort the grind was not very fine.

I really enjoy this product. It is a conical Burr, although made of plastic, it makes a consistent grind for espresso. You can adjust the grind by loosening or tightening the inside where the coffee grinds fall out of. you do get a little bit of a workout using it but what do you expect from a manual grinder? Overall it's a great grinder! Best part about it was for me, you can pour the grinds directly into a portafilter and not worry about spilling any!

I have yet to find anything bad to say about this product. I have been using it since last May to grind coffee for my "cold brew" using my eeKay brewer and it works as designed. I have had no issues with adjustments in fact, I purchased a bag of coffee from Starbucks. I had them grind it to their most coarse setting and it didn't come close to what I can do with my WHEROAMOZ. No, I don't work for the company and in no way am I connected other than through Amazon. I like to give credit where credit is deserved. The only mistake I made was not filling out my registration form for a life time guarantee, oh well my problem.

It’s not big but it grinds enough beans to make a 10 cup pot. Nothing better than fresh ground coffee.. It has a nice design with a stainless steel grinder and manual crank. Pour beans into the top and grind. Easily stored and perfect for travel or camping.

I purchased this to use on mornings when I have to leave very early and don’t want to awaken my neighbors with the sound of my electric grinder (I live in an apt building). This grinds so easily and evenly that it’s all I use now! I brew a small French press (10 oz) or larger 17 oz press. Either one requires about a minute of grinding, at most. No more coffee dust on my counter, no more sludge in the bottom of my cup. I love it!

We just got it but am reviewing already because my son dug in and said “no more electric ones to break down now mom - I can use this ever time” It’s a little bitty thing (looks bigger in the picture to me) but it will be nice to have this hand grinder so we can actually have coffee each morning. Something about the electric ones quality now-a-days; they are unreliable.

I recommend this product.
This little machine is quality. Even opening the box I knew I was getting into a nice product. Everything about it feels good and well worth the price.

I had a different model manual hand grinder before that didn't take so long to grind my beans. I find I am grinding for 5 minutes just to empty the whole beans. My apple watch keeps suggesting I take credit for an elliptical workout!!!

I am not much of a coffee drinker. I bought it basically more to grind dried herbs in small quantity for daily use for which a food processor is too big. It works like charm.. grind fresh spices for your daily tea in a jiffy.. worth the price.

only used for a few days, works. I am grinding smaller some Larger grinds i had in fridge. It takes a lot of turn to produce. them may be quicker with whole beans.

Follow up. The only thing missing from the reviews is. how long it takes to grind your coffee. I use a 4.5 oz stove top
Bialetti Moka Express. It takes about 5 minutes(never timed it). I watch TV while I am grinding. This uses a small amount of coffee.

Another fantastic cup today after grinding new beans in my grinder. This thing is great. Not sure if the grind is any better than the electric ones but it is nice not to have the noise associated with them This thing is great - I plan to take it with me on trips too. A+

This can be taken with you when you're traveling or put on your desk at work. It's easy to use and clean. Takes some getting used to. My first one came with the handle loose and I contacted support. They let me know they'd send out a new one to me and it came pretty quickly all things considered. I can take the handle off and put it on the other, so that's great. I really love this manual grinder.

This little grinder is SO convenient, it’s easy to store and doesn’t take up hardly any space on the counter. We travel often and it's great for all the hotel rooms. It took a few tries to get it right, in the end it easily grinds with no effort. It is very easy to clean and I love the stainless steel, very modern look!! Also it comes with a lifetime warranty, you can't beat that!! I definitely recommend!!

This coffee grinder is a stylish grinder suitable for a pot of coffee. You can pay the same price for a grinder at your local Walmart, but it isn’t going to look and be of quality like this one. I am thoroughly enjoying the use of it and it is indeed easy to disassemble and clean. It’s perfectly sized to fit in most hands as well. Would recommend this especially at the $20 price point!

I bought this grinder for use at work. This is my 3rd hand grinder. The others 2 (each from a different companies) broke similarly when a cheap piece of plastic in the ceramic cones cracked and rendered them useless, both within a year. This one appears to have different operating mechanisms and seems well made. I also like the folding crank. It gets the job done and I'm hoping I won't need to rely on their lifetime warranty.

reviews.reviewTitle: Well constructed, easy to use and store comes with lifetime guarantee
reviews.reviewText: This is my first manual coffee grinder. Stainless steal, well constructed and simple to use. Simply put your coffee beans in the top section, regulate the knob on the bottom to set your desired coarseness and turn the handle. Perfect size for home and travel. Doesn’t take up much room. Grinds coffee from powdery fine for espresso or coarse for french press. Comes with a lifetime guarantee…

This grinder is tiny, but perfect for travel for one person. It grinds enough for a cup or two, making sure you have the freshest brew no matter where you go. Adorable and shiny, I will have no qualms about whipping this out on any of my trips.

Read that a burr system was the best way to treat your coffee beans so purchased this grinder. Super easy to use and adjust the level of coarseness, used with my pour over system and enjoyed the best cup of coffee ever. Handle folds too so you could take it anywhere, and under $20! Great deal for you or a gift for your fav coffee lover! Don't hesitate to buy!

I got this because I’m the only coffee drinker in the house and needed to grind coffee for my CoffeeGator French press. I wanted a burr grinder that was quiet and easy to use and this fits the bill. Plus, it’s so compact it’s great for those with limited storage. I was worried it would be difficult to use because I’m left handed, but I have no problems. I’m very happy with it.

reviews.reviewTitle: I really like this...A great bean grinder
reviews.reviewText: I am very happy happy with this coffee grinder. It has multiple settings to allow for a choice of bean coarseness. Very well made with stainless steel and also sturdy. It is small enough to take along when travelling. ... and looks very handsome on the kitchen counter. I use it with both my French press and my everyday Bunn-O-Matic Added bonus is that it is quiet...no noisy motor...

reviews.reviewTitle: Well made,a snap to use and clean!
reviews.reviewText: So happy to have found this well made, practical grinder!I was looking for a non electric,hand held, and this is the one.Have arthritis in my hands, the triangle shape is just right! Love it

When I saw the price I really wasn't expecting something so well made. I ordered it for when my husband and I travel but we have now retired our regular home grinder and only use this one. It's so easy to use and stores nicely in my cabinet.

I tried my grinder for the first time yesterday and it is very easy to put together and is pretty quiet. It does allow you to adjust the coarseness of the grind. I like it very fine as I use a melitta pour over drip for my coffee. It does take awhile to grind since I like it very fine, but that's to be expected from a manual grinder. This grinder looks really nice and seems sturdy.

Usually issue I have with similarly priced grinders (I have used 4 different ones I hope this will be fifth and last for some years) is inconsistent grind size.
Grind size settings are also easy to set. I use it for pour over and french press.
I would increase size of chamber for beans. Full chamber fill the the chamber of ground coffee by 80%,(+10% to bean chamber -10% to ground coffee chamber would be better for me ) which just little bit less than my morning doze, may be it'll help me to reduce my coffee consumption.

This grinder is about 8" tall made of nice stainless steel. I like the clear It has an expensive sleek look to it. I have also used it too grind coarse salt and peppercorns. It works great. The size fits well in my hand to grind with, fits neatly in my kitchen drawers and great size for travel. Easy to take apart for cleaning. It seems to be well made and durable.

I love the fact that it doesn't require electricity to grind my coffee in the morning. I'm kind of a coffee snob so it will be really nice to be able to take with me when I travel and I also really enjoy the fact that you can grind it depending on how coarse you want the blend to be. I have only tried it with coffee but someone said they tried it with spices too in the reviews and that might be cool to try too.
I love dress ground coffee. We travel a lot for sports and it is hard to find good coffee on the road. This is small enough to pack and easy enough to use! I am so glad I found it!

reviews.reviewTitle: Finally able to grind the coffee that’s been sitting in the cupboard!
reviews.reviewText:
This is a great tool for grinding the perfect a
Amount of coffee for a few cups at a time. I had coffee in my cupboard for a year, and with this great tool I’m able to grind my self the perfect amount when I need it. I love that I don’t need to grind it all at once so I can keep the rest of it fresh and unground for when I want it.

I really like this little coffee grinder. I have an electric type, but it is not convenient for travel. This actually works better too. It is very well made and I find it easier to judge if my grind is the way I like it because with an electric, you can quickly overgrind it. Great investment if you love freshly ground coffee.

This is a great traditional coffee grinder. It is portable and so easy to use. I like how easy it is to clean also. With so many expensive and complicated coffee machines nowadays, this is a breath of fresh air!

This little coffee grinder is great. It's compact and easy to use. It's also easy to clean which is a huge plus. It's sleek looking with it's silver finish. Perfect to use every day and small enough to take with you.

reviews.reviewTitle: Well made and easy to use.
reviews.reviewText: We travel frequently and love strong coffee. We have a travel espresso brewer and this pairs nicely with. We can grind whole bean strong coffee lickty split. It was super easy to use and clean.

I love how easy this is to use! Super lightweight! Small, the but perfect amount for making a carafe of French Press. Grinder handle extends making it easier to grind, and for travel, takes up less space. The different levels of grinding help to make a great cup of coffee on larger grinds and a nice thick, rich cup with the smaller grinds.
Broke after just a months...

I thought it would be unreliable, but if it serves me for several purposes, it will be good. For as small quantities and daily uses as ours; it's more than just right. We found good use for our special morning drink and were never unpleasantly surprised. I believe we will enjoy it for quite a while.
Easy to use perfect for a small amount of coffee to grind. I recently bought some coffee beans and needed this so bad and couldn’t be happier with my purchase.

reviews.reviewTitle: My first coffee grinder...nothing like fresh ground coffee
reviews.reviewText: I always wanted fresh coffee grounds so I decided to give this grinder a try. I like that it is portable as it doesn't take up much space in my cabinet. The grinder was easy to use as the instructions were clear on using the device. Was able to make fresh grounds for both my coffee brew pot as well as my re-usable K-Cup for my Keurig.
My husband is notorious for grinding beans in the late or extra early hours and waking the house up. This grinder is quiet and does a great job. Grinds well and is easy to use.

It was easy to use, I can control how much I like to grind my coffee beans, It's great for traveling fit just right in my bag. I first thought it was going to be a lot of work but it wasn't. I can control if I want it fine or coarse coffee grind. It fits in a drawer and doesn't take up space. I really like.
Funny how something small can be so useful in my house hold we all coffee drinkers and I like to buy my coffee beans fresh and whole well this little grinder helps it my beans the way I want it

I bought this because I left the one I owned home. Though similar in function this brand is better for travelers. The handle folds in for storage and easy for storage. Yes you have to use a bit of muscle, but for me it’s a bit of warmup before great coffee is made. Overall, great grinder.
Works as advertised. Smaller than expected but not a problem. Takes a few runs to learn how to grind to the size of bits that you desire.

I used this product for the first time today. I have never used a coffee grinder before, and this one works just right for my needs. Your arm gets a little tired from grinding, but I assume this is to be expected with a manual grinder. Other than that, it’s easy to use. I am pleased with my purchase!

If you need fresh ground coffee on the go, this is small and easy to take with you! You're definitely going to build up muscle using it! Which less face it, we all would love to get muscles from drinking coffee!! It even has different settings, like you can change the type of grind you want!

Grinds relatively quietly and gives consistent grinds. As others have stated, it takes a little experimenting with the coarseness settings but it's very simple to do. Durability seems very good. Good value. Very pleased so far.
This manual coffee grinder is compact and slim but it holds a lot of coffee. Perfect for travel or home use. It’s also easy to clean
This is a really good coffee grinder i drink alot of coffee it's so east to use I love it but theres a bonus if you use spices you can use it for grinding spices
Accurate adjustment of grind and simple to use. Good value and simply does what I needed in a burr type grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: The best part of waking up.
reviews.reviewText: I really love this bean grinder. It is very easy to use. The size is perfect, very easy to travel with. I like that it is manual. That is a great help when I am out camping. It adjusts very easily. I can grind for a drip or perculator in a matter of seconds.

reviews.reviewTitle: Amazing product and exactly what I was looking for!
reviews.reviewText:
This product has a clean sleek look and feels very sturdy. The stainless steel and other component feel high quality and well built. The product itself is super easy to use and will 100% be packed in all of our camping trips.

I would highly recommend!

I found the process of manual grinding to be a stress reliever, and I think of it as almost a pepper grinder but for coffee. I love the smell of freshly ground coffee beans, you can fill up the reservoir and only grind upon usage to get the same freshness every time!
This took forever to grind the beans and I think it got clogged. It does not function well. I will be buying an electric grinder.
This is a great little coffee grinder for camping. Durable and easy to use. It grinds my coffee fine for my espresso. I am really happy with this purchase.
The grinder fits right inside of the reusable k-cup so one does not have to transfer the messy coffee grounds!

Perfect for travel or light office use. Can grind at a proper espresso level as well!
Keep in mind that this is for very small batches - so anything more than a 2 cup French press is rather impractical. That said, it is just what I wanted.
Loved using this so awesome
Works great, I was a little on edge when the price seemed cheaper than most but I was pleasantly surprised with how well it works and holds up.

It is small and stylish Coffee Grinder, so I leave it out on my counter; looks great. I use it in the morning to grind up some fresh beans for an espresso - it gives a perfect grind for my machine, and I can put in just enough for a double shot.
I like this coffee grinder. It is adjustable so you can choose how fine your want your coffee ground. It is convenient to travel with.

reviews.reviewTitle: Did exactly what I wanted it to do...
reviews.reviewText: The ground was perfect. It is very easy to use. It is manual, so expect to do a little work to get your beans ground. It gave me the perfect ground for my french press. It's smaller than you might think, but I like that. Still works great.
I like this coffee grinder. It's not overly sized, so it's good for travel. It has a large capacity. It's easy to clean. Works great!
Didn't even get through one grinding....broke on first use.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is what you’re looking for!
reviews.reviewText: I used this product for imported coffee beans I get from Brazil - it is a great tool and small to boot! Breaks down into several pieces - easy to carry with me. Great price for the item. Very smooth grinder.

I don't often grind my own beans, but wanted to have a conical burr grinder for small batches of special coffee now and then. Didn't want to drop $100 on a fancy-schmancy electric burr grinder. This guy fit the bill perfectly! It's simple, solid, and well-built. Adjustable grind for different brew methods, and a nice little cup to catch the ground coffee. Great value for the money.

I love this. I've been wanting to get a coffee grinder for awhile and decided to try this one. It works perfect and it's not big and bulky so I can store it easily in my kitchen or pack it to take on trips with me! I already recommend it to my family!

very good product I loved it is very beautiful it is easy to use and clean it is ideal to take it anywhere a picnic or to use it at home apart cm is small does not waste coffee grinds only what you will use

This was a small compact grinder that I expected to be able to take on road trips, it did not disappoint me, it does the trick. Grinds as you would want it, with the options of different grinds. Fine, med, course and these are great choices. Easy enough to clean.

I was tired of getting all the "junk" in my cup after using a normal electric grinder with my French Press, so wanted to pick up a conical grinder. This one is grinding consistently and keeping the grit out of my cup... I like it!

It does take a few minutes to grind the beans, but I always need more exercise as well, so can kill 2 birds with 1 stone.
I love the results I get with this. Very consistent. Seems to do a better job than my burr grinder. And I can take it camping!
My husband is so excited for this manual coffee grinder. He’s a coffee lover and he likes to grind his whole coffee himself.

This grinder is very easy to use and clean. It is compact and looks great on my counter. It would easily fit in a suitcase for traveling. The grind is perfect for my coffee maker and my espresso machine. I am loving the fresh smell of coffee in the morning!

reviews.reviewTitle: Ceramic grinding does the job well.
reviews.reviewText: The grinder is well designed and works exactly how it should. I like that I can adjust the grade from coarse to espresso fine. Clean up is simple, just rinse it out let dry. One capful easily brews 1 liter of coffee and takes me about 2-3 minutes start to finish. I would buy again.

reviews.reviewTitle: As Described and Easy to use
reviews.reviewText: I had no idea there was a manual coffee grinder, I dislike using my electric one because it wakes everyone up too early when I use it. This one, once you get the correct grind setting that you desire all you do is fill and crank!

reviews.reviewTitle: This is a great little coffee grinder for travel!
reviews.reviewText: I travel a lot for horse shows and this is the perfect size grinder to keep in my trailer. It does not take up a lot of space and grinds enough coffee for 4 cups each time. I would recommend for someone needing a portable grinder.
This is so fun and easy to use! I love that I can grind my coffee myself! My son loves using it and it keeps him occupied!
This product does just what is it supposed to. Does it well. Highly recommend purchasing this product.

It arrived on time
Its easy and understanding to know how to use
The crank handle is a bonus the color is negotiable
Overall 5 stars
I recommend this product traveling is easy and less stressful cleaning is a challenge but worth it
Easy to use! Doesn’t take up a lot of cabinet space which is perfect. Just what I was looking for.

This will grind coffee from extra fine to very coarse. Easy to use, easy to clean and will easily pack in your luggage for travel. The only caveat is if you like your grind very fine, you might find it difficult to grind.

I love that this has a very contemporary feel! I wanted a small grinder to take to the office, but this is so classy I have decided to keep with my coffee station at home. Hubby has spied it for his spices. Compact but elegant.

Love the coffee grinder. I love the smell of fresh coffee in the morning. I have had family over for coffee and they love the grinder and the aroma throughout the house. I recommend this product to any and every coffee lover.

I love this thing. I have ground coffee beans for my morning Joe since the 1980s with the same Krups blade grinder. The Catalyst coffee shop owner in Saint Albans, Vermont (an amazing place) convinced me burr grinding was the way to go. I found this one after some research. I love that it grinds so easily and evenly and that you can see it in the cup at the bottom of the unit. Very pleased!
This is well made little grinder. Great to have when you lose power. In no time you will have perfectly even grinds.
This coffee grinder is functional and does the job. It requires some manual labor, obviously, but it does the job and is a nice part of my coffee morning routine.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use and nice looking
reviews.reviewText: I’ve wanted to have a coffee grinder for so long after using a blender to grind my beans. This grinder makes me feel like a true coffee connoisseur having a way to easily grind fresh coffee for every cup with easy cleanup.

If you’re a coffee drinker and you like it fresh this is the must have item to get you there. It’s very easy to use and clean afterward. I also like the design is very sleek and sturdy. It came with a warranty which is nice in case of something happened.

I like the overall build quality, the fold-able crank handle and the clear receiver. It does take a little time to grind enough beans to make a full carafe with my french press but for doing single cup brewing it's a breeze.
The Manual Coffee Grinders works good with me. The material is good and gives me fresh and precise grinded coffee
The size is small so easily store and easy to bring when you travel. . Also. Easy to use and clean.

Petite grinder but ready to use. Fully portable for travel, but I use it at home. Easy to open and close. Takes little effort to grind the beans into powder. Pairs well with my French press for an amazing cup of coffee.

After a trip to France I was craving espresso, so I picked up a stove top pot and realized I needed a burr grinder. Saw the reviews (and prices) for electric grinders and decided to give hand grinding a try. So far this grinder has been great. Easy to use, easy to adjust, you just gotta get used to the idea that it'll take a minute or two to get the job done. In fact, it outperforms an electric burr grinder because I can take this one camping.
I tried it for the first time today, and it works smoothly.
Great product! Coffee grinding beast! So aesthetically pleasing, as well!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Built quality coffee grinder for best aroma and taste
reviews.reviewText: working as expected right out of the box and also build quality was good and sturdy .reasonably priced unit and what else any one wants .buy and enjoy aroma of coffee beans after grinding and for good quality coffee which feels great on every day morning .

I used it this morning to grind my coffee beans. My coffee tasted so fresh and good! It's very easy to use and even has settings on how you want your coffee grounds and one last thing it's very sturdy when grinding the coffee beans!

I have used it a couple of times and love it already. It has multiple levels to grind coffee beans from coarse to fine. It is very lightweight and easily portable. Very easy to clean as well. Highly recommend it.

My husband and I travel a lot for school,
Work, and family, we like our morning coffee and this grinder is easy to use, needs no power and simple to grab and throw into our suitcase. Just what we needed!

This coffee grinder is great, compact size to carry anywhere. So far I have been using it to grind pepper, and coffee. Easy to set the desire grinding texture, I like mine medium coarse but you can set it coarse or fine grind.

This is a sleek, elegant, hard-working little coffee grinder, that can grind a lot of beans in a short period of time! It is easy to use, well made, and very nice looking, as well as perfectly functional! Best grinder I have ever had!
So easy to use. Stores a couple pots worth. Can take camping too.
My husband is a coffee lover, this is one the best presents I’ve bought for him

reviews.reviewTitle: Solid Stainless Steel, Grinds Well, Compact!
reviews.reviewText: I love that this grinder is so compact, as counter space in my kitchen is sacred. It is very heavy duty, made of solid stainless steel. It grinds very easily and works very well. Compact for travel which is great!

Works very well! Easy to adjust the fineness of the grind. The shape of this coffee grinder make it easy to hang onto while grinding. Fit & finish is excellent. I could definitely see packing it along while traveling, too. Quality item!

This thing is so small and portable! I'm moving soon so this'll be really easy to transport.
It ground up my coffee beans really well, and the instructions were easy to follow.
Wash it out before use of course. Super handy and cute.
Such a great grinder!! Simple and easy to use!
I started spending 4 minutes of grinding time for my coffee every morning. I take it as a supplemental morning exercise. Build quality is great and it makes me miss my electric grinder too.
Just used it as it was bought for camper, loved how easy it is to use. Takes awhile to grind enough coffee for a couple of days but can sit in my chair & take in the scenery at the lake at same time!
Love the metal casing, feels upmarket! Grinds the coffee fines very evenly as well!

I bought this product May of 2019 and until now I am still enjoying it. I prefer using a manual ceramic burr as compared to stainless steel and so far the product is not a disappointment. Easy to clean as well. I am using a small fine bristle soft toothbrush to clean the burr itself. If only this product comes with its own brush, that will complete it. Anyway still an amazing product for coffee lovers.

reviews.reviewTitle: Quick and even grind without a fuss!
reviews.reviewText: Fantastic grinder for a few cups of coffee. Well built, easy to use and clean

I've love using this coffee grinder and making my coffee now. Grinding does not take too much force; it's very light-weight and compact, which is perfect as counter space is a premium in my kitchen! Thanks!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great coffee grinder to the consistency you enjoy
reviews.reviewText: Just got it and couldnt wait to use it. It was perfect. Just as expected.. it grinded the beans to the consistency I like for the perfect brew. The aroma was pure heaven. Definitely need another to keep at work.
It works great, it's lightweight, and being able to adjust the grind is awesome.

I use this grinder in the mornings. I grind just enough for one cup at a time and it's perfect. I love that the handle retracts back on itself so it's not so top heavy when not in use. Also I love the clear cup so I can see how much I've ground (I don't like terribly strong coffee so I only use about 1/3 to 1/2 of the cupful.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very handy to use and bring!
reviews.reviewText: Accidentally bought coffee bean at bluebottle so I was looking for a cheap coffee grinder. Found this and it works very well for the price.It's small and very handy that you can bring anywhere.

I wasn't sure about buying this because I have arthritis, but I have to tell you it fits perfect in my hand is easy to hold and easy to crank. I absolutely love this grinder! Works perfect and is so easy to use
I have tries product on French press grind and it works great. had trouble registering product but received a lot of help from company. I would recommend this product to anyone.

reviews.reviewTitle: As good as they get at this price.
reviews.reviewText: I'm rather impressed. The burr adjustment for different grinds actually works. The fit and finish is excellent. The lower container is very clear, thick and rather solid. Even the handle rivets seem pretty good, but might be a weak point, but no issue there yet.

I have a mini French press that I keep at work. This thing is perfect for the amount I need to put in my mini French press. I think this would also be great for camping because it is super lightweight.
You just want to make enough for one coffee, it is perfect for it.
Live being able to grind my own blend of coffee! Can mix different flavored beans to make up own flavor of coffee! Very easy to clean and store! Can even take it with me when on the go and travling!
Stainless steel grinder super easy to use. Very compact so it doesn't take up a lot of space. Nice fold in handle as well. Coffee grinds real nicely. Also easy to desemble & clean.

Great product. The coffee tastes smooth and is more flavorful. Surprised by the difference. In the past I ground the coffee beans in batches of about a pound at a time from where I bought them. Now I grind the beans a cup at a time. Fresh ground to the right consistency, could not be better.

Doesn't grind Flax, either drops whole seeds through or takes an hour to get a tablespoons worth of ground flax. Looks like a quality product, and I'm sure it works well enough for coffee, but save yourself the aggravation if your looking to do smaller seeds like flax...

Love this coffee grinder. You just put the beans into the top and grind. It’s sturdy and easy to use.
I even take it on my travels , as it’s small and portable...

I've always purchased ground coffee for my afternoon cup (I uses a Bialetti Moka espresso pot), but found the pre-ground coffee became stale too fast. Now I buy whole beans and use the Whereamoz manual grinder to only grind the small amount I need for each cup. Since I have to grind the beans first, it does take a bit longer to make a coffee, but the result is sooo much better.
Small and compact which makes this grinder perfect for travel but works VERY well! Not near as noisy as I expected either! Smooth workings makes it easy to use too! I definitely love it!

This coffee grinder is perfect. Small and portable and takes up barely any counter space and matches the color of my espresso maker. Grinds the beans perfectly and makes it so easy to do! Adjustable for fine to coarse, very consistent on the grind. Love the manual grinder makes just enough for one cup of coffee or espresso without having any waste, keeping the coffee fresh. Highly recommended!

reviews.reviewTitle: Good for a cup or two

qAndA.answer: It made of 304 stainless steel and ceramic stones

qAndA.answer: Sorry, I use it exclusively to do a course grind for my French Press. I don’t know how fine a Turkish grind should be.

qAndA.answer: I don't know, did not see any adjustable on the device

qAndA.question: Can it grind cereal?

qAndA.answer: No much strength is needed to grind coffee

qAndA.question: Conical or disc?
qAndA.answer: Conical

qAndA.answer: Stainless Steal

qAndA.answer: It is absolutely worthless for flax seeds.

qAndA.answer: I don’t wash it with soap and water. I just grind some rice in it and that should do the trick. https://www.thekitchn.com/how-to-clean-a-coffee-grinder-cleaning-lessons-from-the-kitchn-16605

qAndA.question: can it grind coffee into Turkish coffee？
qAndA.answer: Yes

qAndA.answer: Not enough

qAndA.question: how do you adjust the grind?
qAndA.answer: There is a black dial on the bottom of the grinder portion. You turn the dial either right or left depending on if you want it finer or more coarse

qAndA.answer: some, but the burr mill is ceramic. there is some plastic holding the crank and everything.

qAndA.answer: It is adjustable. Very fine to about course enough for a French Press

qAndA.answer: Yes

qAndA.question: How many table spoons can it grind at once?
qAndA.answer: During my use it can grind about 15-16 grams of coffee beans per fill. So if you're making a 40-50 gram pour over I usually grind 3 times.

qAndA.answer: This seems to be mostly plastic with some metal parts. This grinder has worked well for me so far.

qAndA.answer: I grind two of these full to one standard pot of coffee.
